I've gone through sooooo maaaaany countless problems with my RCA DLP (if you have any knowledge of t.v's and their dependencies based on models i'd have to ask you to kindly shut up at the moment because I've figured out the mistake that I've made, thank you,) that I was actually skeptical about the way this Samsung looked in the store compared to how it was going to look in my bedroom. Well I bit the $1,100 big one and went for it and my god if I wasn't a couch potato before lord help me now.This t.v. paired with the Samsung BD-P1500 Blu-Ray player I purchased with it (and also reviewed which you can read on my profile,) make one of the best teams since peanut butter and jelly. They compliment and communicate with eachother to a degree beyond my expectations. And the liquid crystal goodness doesn't stop there either. If it's available pick up an HD receiver from your cable provider(if it's not, switch providers because wow, you know it's 2008 right?) and the programs broadcasted in HD will also have you wondering why you bought that outdated RCA in the first place.. I mean.. nevermind.With such a clear and brilliant picture when going in full 1080p it's hard to say anything bad about this t.v., which is why I can't right now. Sure the sound may not be up to par with the standards of the picture but if you have a small 2 speaker sound system laying around somewhere then it's a breeze to hook it up. It's what I did and I haven't thought twice about it. But if you're going to put this screen as the main attraction in your living room (which it can totally handle) then I would go for a nice surround sound system(which I've also reviewed.) It's the least you could do, trust me, when you see this t.v in action you'll understand. (Heck, when you see this t.v. in all it's glory you'd probably want to bring it flowers on a weekly basis.)So go ahead splurge on yourself and get it. You can't go wrong with the quality for it's price. Until then I'll be watching enough of it for the both of us.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, fair sound
Reviews.Author: J. Hartland "TV Guy"
Reviews.Content: Great picture! The very slight matte front surface eliminates window reflections I used to suffer from with my old CRT TV. Stand/base allows TV to swivel for best viewing angle although pix is great even at severe viewing angles. I love the "wiselink" USB port on the left edge of the TV- just plug in your digital camera & view a slideshow in HD!My primary video source is a cable box connected via HDMI. HD channels look stunning and the "analog"/SD channels look better than I expected them to.The only disappointment so far (and the only reason I didn't rate it 5 stars) is the sound when using the built in speakers. Although the audio EQ menu settings help, it is still subpar. I plugged a cheapie amplified speaker set into the headphone jack & the difference was dramatic.BTW - the delivery went off without a hitch - they called to set up the delivery date/time, showed up when they were supposed to, unboxed/turned on the TV to make sure it worked OK.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV!!
Reviews.Author: M. Wilson "twokatmew"
Reviews.Content: After much research, I decided on this TV.  I ordered from Amazon on 4/30 with an est delivery date of 5/9 and, CEVA delivered it on 5/7 (free white glove service).  The TV has a fantastic picture, TV's setup/config is very intuitive, and the sound is surprisingly good for a 10wx2 TV speaker system.  There are plenty of connections, too.  Currently the devices I've connected to the TV are a cable HD/DVR via HDMI, a progressive scan DVD player via component video, and a ReplayTV 5040 DVR via component video.  I've routed the TV sound out to my Denon amp, even though it's standard stereo.  My only real criticism, and a minor one at that, is the size of the remote which initially seems *huge*!  I'm quickly getting used to it though, as the layout is quite intuitive.  The remote is also backlit, a real plus when watching in a dark room!When researching HDTVs, I also considered the 650 and 750 series and compared all to Sony LCDs, but I found the picture on the Samsungs to be *much* better.  Although I would have liked an ethernet connection (on the 750 series), I really didn't want the high-gloss planels on the 650 and 750 series.  (My viewing room is quite bright during the day, and although the glossy LCDs do seem to have an improved picture quality, the added glare turns that into a big negative for me.)  Initially I intended to go for a 120Hz set, but as I did more research, I decided that was a feature I could forgo.  The HD picture from the cable box is phenomenal.  I notice no ghosting, graininess or pixelation.  Even standard def (stretched) is fine to watch.  I expect HDMI-CEC will be a very handy feature as I upgrade components down the road, but for now, I'm unable to make use of it.In sum, I'm very, very pleased with this TV, with CEVA's white glove delivery service, the price I paid, and the 12-month no interest deal I got using Amazon's credit card.  I would definitely buy this TV again and have already recommended it to friends who are currently HDTV shopping.

Reviews.Title: Heaven help you if you need to get this TV serviced
Reviews.Author: Brian White
Reviews.Content: Based on many positive reviews, I bought the LN40A550 from Amazon.  It took 9 days for delivery from CEVA in Cleveland.  With an HD source (cable or blu-ray), the picture is stunning, however, SD cable channels exhibit faint, but noticable diagonal lines that roll across the screen. Window-shade distortion is what the cable tech called it.  This TV definitely has issues with its SD tuner.  If I use the tuner in my VCR, the distortion goes away.  Samsung service is horrible. I have been trying to get Samsung to fix this for over 2 months and have yet to have a Samsung tech come to my home.  Samsung outsources their service to a variety of local techs, and I am on my third one.  Just trying to get them to show up is turning in to quite a challenge.  I wish I would have bought the Sony KDL-40V4100. I also own a Sony KDL-52W4100 and love it; the Bravia engine does a great job with SD.UPDATE - after >2 months, Samsung finally fixed this TV by swapping out the main board.  The Window-shade distortion is gone.  on SD, my Sony still has a much better quality picture.  On HD, they both have a great picuture.

Reviews.Title: Died after 24 Months......
Reviews.Author: Christopher T Bailey
Reviews.Content: Great TV until it died on me. Standard Power Supply issues everyone else had.....they are trying to give me the run around. Well if I cannot get them to provide the repair for free, I'm gonna get a class action started. This is BS this company is denying known issues with all these TVs and they are getting away with doing nothing.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, But has inherent power supply board design issue
Reviews.Author: Elrox
Reviews.Content: I bought this around 1 year before and I can tell you that the image quality and aesthetic appeal are great.But the downside is that this TV has a very basic design issue with its power supply. The electrolytic capacitors used in the power supply are low voltage rated and will eventually blow up(if you are unlucky). The symptoms are clicking sound when powered up, delay in powering up.. And the TV will not power up after a few days. As far as I know, this is a common problem in most of their models released during this time and is a very basic issue which they should have recalled and replaced the faulty capacitors.As a solution, you can replace the capacitors very easily if you are good with handling a soldering iron. I replaced them and it is working good. But I would think that most of the customers would not want to go through the trouble of opening it up and repairing.But other than that, this TV is great and I really love watching movies. I have a hometheatre as the sound does not match with the picture performance of the TV (that is understandable and I dont think of it as a minus).

Reviews.Title: 6ave may ship you the "B" model.
Reviews.Author: R. Wilson
Reviews.Content: I ordered the LN40A550 from this page, and I actually received the LN40B550 from 6ave. This is indeed a "newer model", but the B-type does not have picture-in-picture, and it has the subtle red "touch of color" while the A-type does not. I can't believe they did this! Here's their response:"Thanks for your e-mail. We sincerely apologize but we sent you the upgraded model for the one you ordered. If you do not want the new model, please call us at 877-... for the RA number and the instructions for the return. Thanks."It's not enough of a bother for me to return the thing, but still: caveat emptor!Anyway, the TV is great, although it's not what I ordered!

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: B. Webster
Reviews.Content: Excellent TV for the price!I just purchased this TV. After reading many, many reviews and making comparisons, I believe that we found the best HDTV on the market. We were looking for an HDTV that would provide reliability.I currently have a smaller Sony and ever since its purchase, I have been unhappy with the color and tones and no matter how much I tweaked it, I still cannot get it the way I want.  I thought that ordering HD service would help the Sony, but it is not any better than it was with standard service.Here are some pros and one con:PROS: Excellent picture even without a converter/cable box. We have HD service, but have not used a HD cable box with this TV--just standard service.Menu for tweaking is really easy to navigate and, of course, I tweaked away.View from any angle is really good--not blurry like other flat screens.Great for playing my Wii games.Color and clarity are really nice.CON:Manual could be a little easier to read.  I had trouble figuring out how to set up the Wii (I guess I am TV or manual stupid).Others have complained about the sound, but I must have a "tin ear" because the speakers sound fine to me.Overall, very pleased with the purchase.P.S.  Don't be surprised if you don't receive complete White Glove Service because our delivery driver brought the TV in, put in on the floor and "beat his feet" out the door before I could ask whether or not he was supposed to set the TV up.  It didn't really affect us because we took it right out of the box and hooked up cable. My sister ordered a size up from this one and her delivery people came in, set it up and made sure it was working before they left.  All depends on the carrier.Shipping was much faster than anticipated from Amazon and we did receive a call from the carrier to let us know when to expect our TV.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: EESHELL
Reviews.Content: I just purchased this TV @ $799.00. I did my homework and I wanted to find a decent HDTV that would provide reliability and functionality at under $1000. I was torn between this model and a Sony that was $999. I've always been a loyal Sony buyer and they have never let me down. They are expensive, but I figure you get what you pay for. Until I found out Samsung makes the MAC display screens. That changed my mind about Samsungs.So given the price I went ahead and jumped. I'm really happy with my decision. Overall this is a great value for the money. Here are some pros and cons I found, but the pros outweigh the cons:PROS: Excellent picture even with a regular cable box. I have Time Warner Cable, but I've been too lazy to exchange my regular cable box for an HDTV cable box. I can't really say I will either because I can still pick up channels that broadcast an HD signal, like HBO HD or basic's like TNT HD. They look great!! So I'm not really in any rush to upgrade just yet. Plenty of additional inputs/outputs. The factory settings out of the box need tweeking however, but once you mess with the settings, picture looks incredible. The size is PERFECT for a bedroom or a smaller living room. My living room is small, but the size was just right. I have my xbox 360 hooked up via HDMI - OMG - it looks AMAZING! Totally worth the cash to buy the additional cable. Also - the swivel stand it comes with is very convenient if you want to sit in different places away from the TV.CONS: Sound is horrible relatively speaking. It's okay if you really don't care about bass, but I have to be honest here...even after messing with the settings, the TV has the sound of a clock radio. Seriously. BUT - if you are like me and have your TV hooked up to a decent surround sound system, NO WORRIES. The TV's speakers are irrelevant. However, if you don't want to upgrade to surround sound, I would go with the more expensive SONY set. Sony's have better speakers.For the price - the TV is a value and a great starter LCD HDTV.I will probably upgrade in a few years, but for anyone wanting to go from a small TUBE TV to HDTV this is the TV for you. Just be aware the sound isn't great.Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Don't hesitate, even for a second, to purchase this tv
Reviews.Author: T. Shaffie "Dr. Shak"
Reviews.Content: This product is so incredible that it has prompted me to write my first review on amazon.com ever.I purchased this tv sight unseen, solely based on the reviews I read on amazon.com.  I am exceptionally pleased with the entire transaction.Great price, early delivery, fantastic product!Going from my old standard definition tv to this high definition tv, is like going from a black & white tv to a color tv.  It is that much better!Based on what I had read, my only hesitation was around audio quality.  Consider that a non-issue.  The sound is great!  If you are an audiophile and want superb sound then you can connect it to your audio system, otherwise the built in speakers are great!Enjoy your purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great TV and price
Reviews.Author: Frank L. "knight templar"
Reviews.Content: We have a 37 inch Samsung 1080p HDTV set and just love the picture. We decided to buy another 40 inch 1080p HDTV set and the picture quality is also fabulous. We saw other brands of similar size side-by-side at Best Buy and there is no comparison to the Samsung picture quality. Amazon has a great price and you will not regret your purchase.

Reviews.Title: Pleased
Reviews.Author: BlessedOne37
Reviews.Content: This product was recommended by Consumer Products as a great buy and I am more than pleased.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful!
Reviews.Author: M. Michie
Reviews.Content: We bought this as a gift for our niece and nephew, needless to say, they were thrilled.  Everything about this TV is beautiful - it even looks amazing when it is turned off.  The quality of the picture and performance are everything we were looking for and more.  Now we need one for ourselves!!

Reviews.Title: Good, basic TV
Reviews.Author: Sol-Patrol
Reviews.Content: This product is well-suited to anyone looking for a basic LCD TV who is not concerned with some of the bells and whistles a more expensive unit might offer.  It has a good to very good picture, esp. when HDMI inputs are used, and is fairly attractive.  Also note that, unlike the more expensive Samsung options, the monitor has a "matte" rather than glossy appearance, a big advantage if the TV is near windows or other light sources that may be reflected in a glass or glass-like screen.Pros:Good pictureGood connection optionsInexpensiveNon-reflective monitorCons:Lack of advanced picture and sound optionsFairly poor built-in speakers

Reviews.Title: Works great as a monitor too!
Reviews.Author: DoughBoy & EggGirl
Reviews.Content: Purchased this after reading reviews on c-net and here, targeting a 40" LCD under $1K.  CEVA installers arrived ahead of schedule and were very nice, set up TV correctly and quickly.  Out of the box, the picture was fantastic!  After adjustment with Video Essentials (highly recommended!), it was drop dead gorgeous.  Dialed in all my HD channels automatically and recognized the Sony Blu Ray and integrated into the remote w/no work by me.  But, that's not the best part...!Hooked up an old Mac mini I had hanging around by VGA (haven't gotten the DVI to HDMI cable and tried that... yet!).  Not only did the Mac (wonderful beast that it is) immediately adjust to 1920x1080, but the picture again, was beautiful and the letters on menus and the web browser are sharper than my 27" monitor.  That and at 40", it costed a lot less than a dedicated monitor and has a built in HD tuner.  So, highly recommended to those of you who want to integrate TV and the computer.  I have been watching videos off [....] since I got it and it's great!  Blu Ray like Iron Man are simply awe-inspiring.  I will never go to the movie theater again.Will probably buy another for downstairs PC monitor and another bigger one for my home theater room.  Oh, and for the skeptics in the crowd who follow all the blogs on these screens... I got a "C" type screen (made in Mexico) with firmware 1008.1 and yes, it is truly great, nothing at all wrong as others may suggest.  What I see in the blogs is that the color decoding in the firmware that was created for A and S screens did not work well with the C's and has now been corrected, probably as of version 1007.1 firmware.  Amazon ships very "fresh" TV's (mine was purchased 01/27/09 and was manufactured on 01/31/09!), so I would say it is very likely you will have just as good an experience from this perspective as I have.  Holds a deep black perfectly, no flashlight effect from the backlighting, perfect color tones with only minor adjustment of color and tint.Only negative is that the sound is very poorly adjusted out of the box. You need to adjust the lowest bass way up, mid-range down, and highs up a bit and then you will get a nice even frequency curve.This is the best deal in a 40" LCD on the market now, and twice so thanks to its amazing performance as a PC monitor!  Hope you enjoy yours...!UPDATE: Got the DVI cable and WOW! Even better picture and, when selecting overscan ('JUST SCAN' on this TV), the picture now perfectly fills the screen.  Much better than my other flat screen dedicated monitors and CRT's.  Watching streaming video every night now, recommend a computer and this TV over a DVD player any day.  Note that blu-ray drives are also available for PC's at reasonable prices now as well...- Bud

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a great price!
Reviews.Author: Christina Warren
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I have had our LN40A550 for two weeks and we LOVE it! We didn't buy it at Amazon (a local chain had it for $800 with in-store pickup, so we just did that -- though the price now is equivalent of what we paid with tax), so I can't speak for delivery or anything, but the TV itself is fantastic.The next generation of sets will be out in June, so we wanted a set that could replace the busted rear-projector HDTV in our living room and then move to our bedroom when the new models come out in a few months. The Samsung A550 more than fits the bill. The picture quality is excellent -- especially after using the AVS Forums settings and we love the design of the casing. We've got it on a stand right now, but will be buying the Peerless PA740 Articulating Wall Mount for 22-Inch to 40-Inch Flat Panel Displays (Gloss Black) in a few weeks and mounting it on the wall. Even without mounting, the swivel and having it at a slight angle gives us perfect viewing throughout the living room.In a perfect world, the remote control could be configured to work with the receiver too -- but that's what the Logitech Harmony universal remote is for. We have HDTV, SD cable, an Apple TV and a standard DVD player attached right now -- but we'll be adding a Blu-Ray player next week. Unlike other commenters, I don't think the SD signal looks bad -- it just looks like SD TV. HD, of course, really shines. Play upconverted standard definition content through the Apple TV (running boxee) looks fantastic, and even on my older 5-disc DVD player, the the quality is really nice. Blacks are deep, etc. I can't wait to hook up the Samsung BD-P2500 1080p Blu-ray Disc Player and watch Netflix Instant-viewing in HD.The built-in sound isn't fantastic, but we hooked it up to our 7.1 system almost as soon as we got it. If you are going to use  it in a living room and you don't already have a surround system, look at investing in even a really inexpensive HTiB set-up, it'll be a big improvement. It interfaces perfectly with our Denon receiver, even though it was the model year BEFORE HDMI started becoming standard (the AVR-1905). The optical out pumps all the surround sound signal to the receiver and we don't miss anything.For the price and the size, you can't go wrong. When we bought ours at the store, it still had its original price tag from last summer, which was nearly double what we ended up paying. We almost bought a TV in December, but decided to wait because we were moving to a new place. We couldn't be happier with what we ended up getting.

Reviews.Title: Consumer Reports was right...Very nice TV
Reviews.Author: Catlover
Reviews.Content: Very nice TV, however sound quality is not great which I am aware is par for LCD TVs, except for perhaps the new 630 model which is said to have better sound quality. I was worried about reflection, having lots of windows and sun in my passive solar home and watching most of my TV in the daylight hours....but no problem. It is far better than my old analog In which I had to pull blinds, etc, before I could watch a movie. I am disappointed in the blurring affect when watching sports...movement....however I read that this is common in LCD's and that plasma's are better for sports. Unfortunately, that is mainly what I watch, however I am getting used to it and it is not that big of a deal. I am also picking up many more channels off of my cable than before....music channels, etc. Don't know what will happen when they shut down analog broadcast this month but for now, very nice indeed!

Reviews.Title: Lustworthy Hardware
Reviews.Author: J. Bosworth
Reviews.Content: So... I won't spend your time detailing everything other reviewers have. I will just completely agree with the majority of them and say: this is a gorgeous HDTV.From the excellent styling of the tv itself (gorgeous, even "off"), to the enormous input options, to the seriously capable and clean OSD interface, to the simply stunning visual quality: I can not recommend this HDTV strongly enough.I am a graphics professional, and am very picky about color depth, black point, and lumens  - and can only say that this TV performs beautifully. Best moment yet - connecting my top shelf gaming pc up to this monitor and running Fallout 3 in all its glory: pure awesome.I paired this item with a Samsung bluray player (nice becuase the remotes cross over in functionality), for premium movie viewing. Upconverted DVDs look fantastic, and BluRay...  well, *even more* fantastic  lol.A couple point of contention:As noted by others, the speakers kind of blow. But who the hell would use this tv without a dedicated sound system??The factory default settings are aweful. Brightness was all blown out, blacks were way too black etc... Just get to know the picture settings (again - very intuitive and easy to use) and you too, will be able to coax tremendous image quality out of this awesome tv. (For best results, set Brightness to 30-40, which will produce a very pure black point.)If you have the extra cash (which I didn't), the 650 models have a faster refresh rate (120 hz) - which noticeably smooths the transition of high contrast elements across the screen. As it stands 60hz still looks fantastic.I finally ponied up the cash for a new HDTV this year, upgrading from a dusty CRT. What an amazing difference. If you, like me, have been waiting for a solid quality/price ratio in the lcd market - it's definitely here.Samsung FTW

Reviews.Title: Perfect for off-center seating with lots of windows
Reviews.Author: Father of Two
Reviews.Content: I live in a home which has a small living room full of windows and is arranged with no seating positions directly in front of the TV. This required my TV purchase to have both a wide viewing angle for a full room of viewers and a swivel stand for a single viewer and angling the screen to remove glare from the wall of windows.In addition to the great picture mentioned in all the other posts, this TV is perfect for my viewing situation. The image looks great from all off center viewing positions and the surprisingly wide swivel of the stand clears up any issues of watching TV while enjoying the afternoon sunlight.  You will not be disappointed if your TV is used in less than ideal home theater conditions.

Reviews.Title: This is a great tv !!!!
Reviews.Author: Paul F. Jackson
Reviews.Content: The Samsung 40" Model 550 is a fantastic investment. It was delivered as promised into my home by very cooperative delivery men. They put it in place and helped me get a picture before they left. I would recomend amazon.com to every one. I didn't know they would bring it into my home,some dont.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN40A550 40-Inch 1080p LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Unclemarts "Unclemarts"
Reviews.Content: After months of researching LCD TV's, it came down to reading reviews, comparing prices and finally viewing the TV from a distance commensurate with our room size. The final choice was between Samsung and Sony.  Samsung was the clear winner.The 40" LCD was the appropriate size for our family room. We needed to buy a new TV since our 13yr old TV completey died.This was the correct purchase.  The TV has a great picture in HD (especially football games).  Non HD also has a sharp resolution.Amazon had the best price by at least $200 over Circuit City, Best Buy and others. If you can purchase this TV for under $1000, dont hesitate a minute.  Shop around first.

Reviews.Title: Yes, we're happy!
Reviews.Author: Hendrick Kipp "Rick Kipp"
Reviews.Content: This is our first flat panel tv, and we couldn't be happier. TV and DVD's are superb quality. Sound may be a bit weak, but we can always add a speaker system. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 1080p LCD 401n HDTV
Reviews.Author: Joyce A. Rutledge "Alyce"
Reviews.Content: The TV arrived promptly and the men unpacked it and set it up and tested it to see that it worked.  I am very pleased with it so far.  The glare I had with my old TV is gone or barely visible without me having to pull the drapes every afternoon. Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: Incredible hi-def picture but what about non-HD?
Reviews.Author: JZ82
Reviews.Content: 1. Delivery--flawless and timely (ordered from Amazon). I connected it to our Comcast HD cable box, plugged in in, and haven't stopped watching since.2. Hi definition channels look INCREDIBLE. The much-feared glare from the polished black frame turned out to be a non-factor. It doesn't get any better than this (of course, this is my first step up from conventional old fashioned TVs, so what do I know?).3. BUT...non-HD stations pretty much look blah. Foggy, snowy, ghosted, continually refocusing, some better than others, but none of them up to par. With some adjusting of contrast, sharpness, and other options, I have been able to "thicken up" the display so the flaws are less obvious, but this isn't the way it's supposed to be.So the question for those in the know is: What up? Is it a lemon (I doubt it)?  Is it typical and we all have to live with it until all stations are HD (that would be suprising since I have been on digital cable for years with flawless display on regular TV)? Is it a bad cable box? Or is there a setting I have overlooked?

Reviews.Title: CEVA shipping
Reviews.Author: K. Gopalakrishnan "Kars_g"
Reviews.Content: After seeing review written here i was really worried about the TV being shipped at the right time. I ordered the TV on Sunday(10/19/08) , amazon put their scheduled delivery to be on Monday the 27, Ceva said it to be on Friday but guess what it was delivered on Wednesday evening, 2 days ahead of schedule quoted by ceva & 5  days ahead of what was put by amazon. They came in set it up, it was real good service. Thanks to the reviews i called them the minute it was in the city & scheduled appointment. Overall a good service

Reviews.Title: An honest review from an informed shopper.
Reviews.Author: Beau Gatlin
Reviews.Content: I finally decided to purchase this model after much deliberation. I really wavered between this model and the Sony KDL 40v4100. Really, the only reason I was even considering the Sony was because the sound is much better. I had come across so many reviews on this website and others that stated the bottom firing speakers sounded awful...They are correct, they sound absolutely hollow and muffled. Right now I actually have the sound running through my $50 Panasonic bookshelf CD player and it sounds about a million times better than the TV.The picture is incredible!!! We don't have cable, just have a $30 antenna attached and the picture is incredible, better than the last cable we had. So for those of you curious about that, as long as you can pick up the signal it is awesome.As for CEVA delivery... I live in the Dallas metroplex so the TV was in my area 1 DAY after ordering, it was estimated to arrive in 7 days, I called CEVA and asked if I could pick the TV up from the warehouse, they said yes. I checked the TV out in the bay and it looked ok, so I took it home.It is my opinion that external speakers are a must, but the picture is worth the extra expense.

Reviews.Title: Good deal, great picture
Reviews.Author: Tommy Teague
Reviews.Content: The price for this TV on Amazon seemed to be reasonable, so I went to a local electronics store to check it out in person.  The picture was by far the best of any similar sized TV in the store, and the price was about $300 higher than on Amazon.  So I went home and ordered it from Amazon.  The only problem I've had with it is that the sensor for the remote is on the far right side of the TV and is blocked by the cabinet into which I set the TV.  I fixed that problem with a remote extender, but for an additional $40.  If you don't have the TV in a cabinet or enclosure, then that won't be a problem.  Overall, a great TV for a great price.

Reviews.Title: Great T.V. for the price
Reviews.Author: The Twinkie
Reviews.Content: Bought this T.V. back in July.  I've been very pleased with the picture quality.  Yes, the speakers aren't great, but you can always buy better speakers if you need them.  Hook up is easy, just plug it in and it takes care of it's self pretty much.Blu-Ray movies are amazing to look at, as are PS3 games.  I'm looking forward to buying Planet Earth at some point and watching that.Remember to check back to the Amazon website for price changes.  If the price goes lower, email them, and they'll refund you the difference.  I did that about 4 different times.  They never asked any questions and just credited my card.Overall, if you're looking for a T.V. that doesn't bust your wallet, then this one is for you.

Reviews.Title: WOW WOW WOW
Reviews.Author: Francesca Larsen "hardrock2007"
Reviews.Content: Is this TV Worth the value,,,... hmmmm let me think a minute,.... YES YES YES this tv is "OFF THE CHAIN". The sharpness, the brightness, the color, WOW WOW WOW I cant even tell you how this is so unbeliveable like you are sitting right there. I just watched Phelps win the 8th gold metal and I swear I was in the "water cube" with him.  If you have not bought this miracle piece of electric equipment yet,  why why why get it you will LOVE IT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: great tv, great value
Reviews.Author: Jeff W
Reviews.Content: This is our first hd tv.  We bought an hd tivo and this tv and the results are fabulous.  We just got it yesterday.  Our room is large with a wall of windows (not on the wall facing the tv, but the side wall) and the tv is great with no glare and plenty of brightness in daylight and at night.  The picture is fabulous - amazingly clear, sharp and bright.The sound is suspicious - I haven't optimized it yet with the equalizer.  Sometimes it sounds fine but sometimes I've noticed it sounds poor.  Part of the problem is the tv is recessed in a deep cutout in the wall and the speakers are on the back of the side of the tv & there's a big hollow, wood space behind the tv for the sound to bounce around in.  I've considered putting something soft (carpet) hidden on the wall behind the tv to deaden the echo - that would probably help.PIP only works with analog channels and is not easily accessible on the remote - disappointing since analog broadcasts will cease next year and are lower quality anyway...  You can't switch easily, etc.There is only one svideo input and it is on the side (will eventually get hdmi dvd/blueray player anyway, so that won't matter too much).I don't have enough devices, but I imagine 3 hdmi inputs will be 1 too few.I labored over the 650 for the 120hz feature, but finally decided that that marketing feature was not compelling enough.I'm very happy.

Reviews.Title: THE BEST 40" LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Michael Hipp "Michael Hipp"
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV last week after doing a daily search for four weeks to pick the best one in the 40" catagory (the upper limit for our room size/ratio - and I'm an aerospace engineer, so performance and specs matter). This Samsung blows all the others away. Second would be the Sony Bravia series. Everything is easy to use and intuitive. Picture is excellent - everything as advertised. Would buy one for everyone I know if I could. Amazon price is the best also. If you want a 40" you must have this one. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: Almost excellent
Reviews.Author: Rose
Reviews.Content: The Samsung LN40A550 40-inch 1080p LCD HDTV is everything we wanted in a TV.  I did some research on Samsung products before we made the purchace and Samsung has pioneered a lot of electronics. I have never bought Samsung before and my research made me more comfortable with their products.  It was easy to set up with our DVD and VCR.  The picture is very good and we didn't have to adjust colors or any other fine adjustments. The sound quality was very good and with lots of room for expansion.  The menu for the setup was easy to understand and straight forward. We would buy Samsung again.

Reviews.Title: wow, people on TV have never been so ugly!
Reviews.Author: J. Fulks
Reviews.Content: This is a great buy!!!  We love the picture, we love the size, and we love the simplicity.  The picture is SO clear with HD signals that you release how ugly some people on TV really are.If you buy this, you will not be disappointed.  And buying from Amazon was SO simple.  The delivery was painless and professional.  The price was great compared to the local big box retailers making this purchase even better in our minds.We are using this Philips MANT-410 Amplified Indoor Antenna to get the great picture.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: D. Schreckengost "Schrecky"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this TV on June 18th.  It arrived at my home on June 25.  I was a little concerned when the delivery box truck skidded to a stop in front of my house but the box the TV was in had no signs of damage and the TV works fine.  I saved $390 as compared to purchasing the TV anywhere local.  Amazon's price was $300 less and there was no tax or shipping charges.  Good deal on a great TV.

Reviews.Title: The BEST HD Starts Here!
Reviews.Author: D. Williams
Reviews.Content: After reviewing several dozen reviews on the best selling 1080P HD TVs I went over to Best Buy and watched them and compared them in person.  Sure enough, this TV, in the 40 in and 46 inch sizes had the clearest, sharpest, brightest, most amazing picture quality I've ever seen.  I wondered if I should step up and pay another $500 for the "red" series TVs with supposedly better contrast ratios and refresh rates, etc. but wanting to keep my purchase price around $1200 or so I went with this TV and now I'm so glad I did!  This TV has plenty of contrast and speed and even the standard speakers on the TV excellent.  My TV arrived in 6 days from the time I placed my order with Amazon and it was carefully delivered to my home with a appt. set up by CEVA shipping.  I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS TV!  The best I've seen at any price or size.  Just get it!  You won't be disappointed!  But if you really want to see what this TV can do you will want to also get a Blu-ray player and a copy of the BBS video Planet Earth.  Absolutely astounding!  Go for it!

Reviews.Title: Excellent quality product, disappointing installation
Reviews.Author: J. Cook
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Samsung LN40A550 during Amazon's after Christmas sale, and after delivery and installation time is taken out of the equation, I've been using it for about two and a half weeks. My experience with this product has been almost entirely positive. Samsung's menus are intuitive and easy to navigate, a feature that seems to apply to all their products, and the remote, while large, does the job well and allows for alot of functionality without ever going near the tv.The tv's appearence is sleek, clean, minimal and modern, and it manages to be pleasing to the eye without taking over the room. As far as inputs and outputs, it seems to provide enough of the high end stuff (HDMIs, along with RGB and component videos) to let you plug all of your high def video sources in simultaneously. For those of you out there considering use as a computer monitor, as I was, I heartily recommend this unit. The VGA looks clean, and the Picture in Picture function allows you to watch tv in the corner (albeit only tv, not a video source) while checking your email or surfing the net.This unit also has a very pleasing picture. Full 1080p, the current best home theatre has to offer, and it shows when plugged into a high def signal. Colors and deep and true, whether watching movies or playing video games, and the refresh rate seems enough to keep up with you, making even fast moving images smooth.There is only one down side to the experience that I have had while purchasing this tv, but it is definately worth mentioning. The shipping company Amazon used to transport this product to me, CEVA, was extremely disappointing. Now, I'm a realist. I received free shipping, and I know that you get what you pay for. But come on, there should be a line between "free" and "we should be paying you for this." When the purchase was made online, I entered my phone number so that CEVA could contact me when my tv was on their loading dock ready to ship. So, days go by, and one afternoon I receive a letter from CEVA, telling me that my tv is in their warehouse, and that I need to call to schedule delivery. When I called the next day, I learned they had been in possession of my tv for four days, but because they chose to mail me, I was just then hearing about it.Then, on delivery day, one installer shows up with my television. Now, I know that every company does things differently, but in my experience any tv 40" or bigger needs two installers, even if just to help them balance the big ungainly box. Once inside, my friend instructed the installer to set the tv up on an entertainment shelf on the wall, about shoulder height. And the installer looks at her like she's asked him to install an irrigation system in our back yard or something. She leaves him alone, goes back in the kitchen, and about five minutes later he follows her in with a clip board. He informs her that his boss told him he should be done by now, and he would like her to sign, saying that she declined the install, so that he can go on to his next job. She refused, which gained her another irritated look, and he proceeded to go back out and finally place the tv on the shelf.In conclusion, an excellent product, and one that I would recommend to anyone looking for a very reasonably priced 1080p unit. However, I would strongly urge Amazon to reconsider CEVA as their shipping and installation choice.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN40A550 LCD TV Review
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: After looking around in a few of the big box stores, I was initially set on purchasing a Plasma flat panel TV, however, as soon as I saw this LCD TV, the clarity of picture was heads above anything else in it's price point.I am yet to upgrade to a Blu-Ray player although the HD content from my local cable provider (Comcast with HD box) is amazing. The NHL playoffs and seasonal baseball games look absolutely amazing. There is little to no noticeable picture blur, and the images are very sharp.Up-converted DVD's are a hit and miss scenario - IMHO, a lot of it depends on how good the original movie was shot, as some movies look great and other's only have a slight improvement.Some examples of one's that look good are "Master & Commander" and "Star Wars 3 - Revenge Of The Sith". Show's like "Chappelle's Show or even something like "Idiocracy" look ok - still watchable, but just ok.Standard-def TV is the same as most regular DVD's - watchable, but no where near HDTV. I'm almost at the point where I don't watch regular-format TV anymore, if it's not in HD, I generally will not watch it - it's that much of a difference - especially MTV HD (mostly concerts on that channel and thankfully NOTHING like the regular MTV) and ESPN - Discovery HD is great, although History Channel is hit and miss - it seems to me that some of the shows are just upconverted and re-broadcast over the HDTV format.The TV has a very nice piano-finish bezel, that is really not noticeable in 99.9% of most regular-viewing scenarios and IMO, adds to the look of the TV. Everyone that has seen this TV in my place has commented on how nice it looks and how GREAT the picture is.The set was literally plug and play (I currently use it connected via the compnent cables which WILL run 1080i and there are upconverting DVD players available that run 1080p via component (web-search Kingwell), with all the colours looking great and the HD picture being very crisp and IMO, much better than anything else in it's range.Admittedly, it is a new TV (I've had it for about a month now), so I am not sure of the reliability, but time will tell. In any event, I highly recommend this TV for an "out of the box" great picture, without any of the hassles of Plasma.NOTE - the white glove service of Amazon was also great and the set arrived days before it's original ETA, which is always a nice surprise.Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV for the Price!!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "lynsteve1"
Reviews.Content: Got this TV delivered yesterday via the 'White Glove' service and have been amazed at the picture.  VERY easy to set up w/ my digital cable via HDMI cable and have been VERY pleased with the performance so far using the factory settings.  I used component connections for my older DVD-R and it displayed a very nice, crisp picture despite only being a 480p source.The only complaint I have with it is that the stand does not raise the LCD up enough (~3/4 of an inch) to clear the digital cable box and DVD player on the antique piece of furniture we chose to place it on.  I would recommend this set to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Best Bang for Buck
Reviews.Author: Chiu O. Chan "monikerdude"
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to say much; every other review here is pretty clear on the awesomness of the A550The reason I got this TV was because for $1,070, I got a 40" 1080p 30,000 to 1 contrast ratio and 5 ms response time. it's a pretty high end TV for such a great price. The setup of the connector ports are nice too; everything is easy to access and no need to read the instruction manual to setup. Just take it out of the box (the stand is already attached), plug it in and turn it on. The remote is nice too, but two main issues. I had to point it directly to the lower right corner of the TV to change channels. Also, the glossy plastic is a fingerprint magnet.The speakers aren't all that either. The speakers are on the bottom of the TV and also point down. The voices come out not natural (I think is because I am still waiting for my TV stand; right now the TV is on the floor so the sound is bouncing off hardwood)I will be getting speakers for it.What I definately notice on the A550 over my old Philips HD tv is the contrast ratio. The 30,000 to 1 contrast on the Samsung made a huge difference in Call of Duty 4. I can see dark corners much more clearer now. Oks, I said enough, just buy the TV, the only reason I didn't get the series 6 or 7 was that the cost for 120hz is not worth it. (maybe when the price drops on that one) although the 50,000 to 1 contrast ratio is very tempting.

Reviews.Title: 5 yrs later, it is still going stronger
Reviews.Author: Proud Father of 3
Reviews.Content: Bought in Nov 2008 and it is now than 5 yrs since installation. This unit is still going stronger. No missing or burnt pixels. Sharp picture quality. It has survived at least 20 power cuts and the unit is still going stronger. I think Samsung makes this unit anymore: however, their engineers and quality control team deserve major kudos for this unit.Based on this unit, I have invested in lots of Samsung products (tablets, phones, LED tvs, printers) and none have disappointed me. Great job, Samsung team.

Reviews.Title: Dud, followed by a solid unit.
Reviews.Author: David Wallace
Reviews.Content: Our first one blew in the first couple of months and someone was sent for repair. Long story short, it was replaced with a new unit, which has been operating perfectly for the last 5 years.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: M. L. Zuckerman
Reviews.Content: Has worked flawlessly for years now. Great quality and sturdy construction. Good viewing form many angles..has very convenient swivel base.

Reviews.Title: LASTED Nearly 8 YEARS! LOVE SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS- BEST QUALITY!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I LOVE SAMSUNG products (actually bought this in 2007) and have replaced practically all of my expensive electronics with the SAMSUNG brand. Nearly 8years ago my no-name-brand 40 inch television from Fry's conked out...working when I went to bed and black screen forever when I woke up the next morning. I had gotten it when LCD flat screens were really just hitting the market in popularity but were still really expensive. It taught me as a young person the hard lesson that you sometimes get what you pay for if you want to be a cheapskate. So I saved up for a couple of months and during that time, I did extensive homework comparing brands, quality, longevity, pricing, etc. Everything I read about Samsung electronics and particularly about this brand television screamed HIGH QUALITY above all other brands. I found an on-line store...before that sold this particular Samsung I wanted at a lower cost than it was being offered retail anywhere.It automatically came with a 3-year warranty but I didn't need it. Once the 3 years hit I kept my fingers crossed thinking I was on borrowed time (most electronics these days conk out at about 2 years). I moved around with my beloved 40 inch SAMSUNG for years in California...it even lived for a bit perched high on the wall overlooking the living room of my CA apartment. SAMSUNG looked so serene and beautiful up there even when it was resting between delivering my entertainment. I often found myself staring at it in sheer admiration.More of late, I had a feeling it was getting worn out as most of us do when we get up in age...its little blue light was taking a bit longer to come on...but SAMSUNG'S wonderful warm chirping tone signaled it was ready and willing as always.Recently SAMSUNG took the longest move ever in my backseat to the great state of Texas(always in my backseat safely strapped in a box surrounded by protective blankets). I held my breath as I undid the box tape to help my SAMSUNG out....it so despises being boxed up. SAMSUNG cautiously came out of its cramped box, stretched its stand, took its place atop its matching Z-Line black and silver stand and commenced the duty at hand of airing my network programs splendidly with crystal clarity as always to my delight and amazement.Last night I heard a loud pop kind of like a soda bottle that was bent suddenly gets unbent. It caused me to look startlingly in SAMSUNG'S direction and my heart leapt with fear and concern. Yet SAMSUNG kept working perfectly so I dismissed the incident and went back to relaxing with my regularly scheduled programming. After all, my own joints tend to dole out loud pops as well. However, this morning SAMSUNG took a bit longer than usual for its blue light to come on but it did and SAMSUNG aired programming in all its multi-colored splendor. We left the house in the afternoon to run an errand and when we came back, we came back unfortunately to a black screen. No amount of coaxing could wake SAMSUNG up....It seemed that SAMSUNG'S chrystal flat screen remained cold to the touch and its eye dark forever more. My SAMSUNG had taken its final curtain and slipped away silently while I was absentia. SAMSUNG slipped away to the place all worn out televisions go...TV heaven. I am so very heavy hearted. I really needed an upgrade to the latest out there but after nearly 8 long years with me, I cannot begrudge my SAMSUNG LN-40A550 its due eternal rest. I am now in mourning and have begun to wear all black throughout this dark period.If I could give my loyal SAMSUNG a eulogy of 10 stars I would. I ADORE YOU AND SAY A LONG GOODBYE TO YOU. May you RIP my electronic buddy. It will be hard to replace you, but replace you eventually I must as my Z-line stand and my wall are so very barren. But rest in peace knowing that I, your beloved owner will ONLY replace you with a newer larger model of the same name...the SAMSUNG brand. Semper Fidelis my flat screen buddy.-Be, a loyal Samsung customer

Reviews.Title: capacitor issue
Reviews.Author: B. Arcure
Reviews.Content: [...]  A hotline number is on that page.  I am so grateful for this settlement.  After talking to someone on the hotline I was given the name of a repair store in my town that is supposed to contact me to come out and fix our tv.  We have the cycling problem which takes about five minutes for the tv to come on.  This is one of the common issues caused by the capacitor problem.  It sound like the settlement should be extended to more recent models based on other reviews here.  I do really like this tv and I wish Samsung would do the right thing so this tv can be enjoyed without unreasonable risk.  Apparently the link to the capacitor settlement is not allowed in my review, but you can do a search for samsung capacitor settlement.  My television has been fixed.  My recommendation is to call the hotline number on the settlement page instead of paying up front and filing a claim.  The tv repairman they contacted for me was very familiar with the issue, did the job quickly, and did not bill me.

Reviews.Title: Great start, irritating now
Reviews.Author: G. Gutierrez "G"
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent LCD TV when it arrived. Amazon TV delivery is very well done, with complete in-home setup and a dead pixel check. I got some tips from the AVS Forum on color settings for my firmware version, and tweaked a little from there. Amazing picture.But, not even 2 years in, the screen began exhibiting image retention problems. Now, if I call up the cable guide grid for more than 20 seconds or so, then dismiss it, I can still see the Ghost of Grid. The brightly-colored menus in the PS3 Amazon VOD app are even worse. But at least that fades after a minute.On the permanent side, I have a blurry dark vertical line coming down the left side of the screen, around where the pillar box edge is. No matching line on the right side. Over there, I have an inch-wide band of blurry brightness running across and down the top-right corner. I have never moved or abused the panel. I don't watch an excessive amount of 4x3 material, and I've been very careful not to leave a static image from any PS3 game on screen (I don't have time for much PS3 gaming anyway). I have other LCD TVs and large LCD computer displays with zero problems. If there's a fix, I'd love to know what it is. I've tried displaying a slideshow of alternating 100% black, then 100% white images. No change. Unfortunately, the Samsung website is useless and support is a dead end.Apparently, I've been lucky to avoid the bad caps power issues. So there's that.I probably won't buy another Samsung next time. I've had Panasonic TVs recommended, and I like that LG is specifically noting when they use a superior IPS panel in some models. Come to think of it, the only Samsung electronic device I have that still works well is my computer's boot drive, the excellent Spinpoint F3 1TB. But they sold their HD line to Seagate, so that's the end of that. Blah.

Reviews.Title: Will go bad after 3 years but Samsung will fix for FREE!
Reviews.Author: C. Moreiraorantes
Reviews.Content: As many others have stated.  These TVs had bad capacitors on the power board.  This is why it takes so long to turn on as it "warms" up.Call 1-800-Samsung.  Even if it is out of warranty they will send someone to your house to fix this free of charge.Other than this, its a great TV for the reasons many have already stated.Good luck!

Reviews.Title: Just lasted 3 years
Reviews.Author: Paul OFlynn
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV in 2008 and a month ago it started to ghost with red and green.  Now I can't see anything and have had to buy a new one.  Not a Samsung I can tell you.  Sorely disappointed with Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Short life TV
Reviews.Author: D. Jordan
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV in 2008 and the inputs have recently stopped working properly. When I turn the TV on it cycles on and off searching for signals and then I get green screens and purple screens and static skreetching from the speakers for several minutes before it finds a signal. I contacted Samsung about this and was told to replace my surge protector, they believed that was the problem. It wasn't. Now it won't pick up a signal at all.I went to Samsung's website again after their tech support proved worthless to look for a Firmware update in hopes that their were technological descrepencies between my devices that could be fixed with an update. I found dozens of unanswered FAQ's about similar power cycling and slow starting TV's. I was a little disappointed to find them under the heading "Can you answer these?" Thanks a lot Samsung.I purchased a Samsung because I had a Samsung DVD player from the late 90's that was fantastic and still works great. When I purchased a Samsung Bluray player to accompany my new TV I was disappointed that despite the HDMI Anynet Link and the two products being made by the same manufacturer, I still needed two remotes to access the standard functions. Now that I'm having issues with the TV picking up signals and not getting useful help from their support team, I'm starting to question the quality of their products and the company. I don't plan on sending any more of my money their way in the near future. I can't afford to replace my TV every couple of years.Amazon's white glove delivery was fantastic though, I think it was free too!

Reviews.Title: Crapped out shy of 3 years old!
Reviews.Author: Justin
Reviews.Content: I was extremely happy with the purchase at first. Fast forward 2.5 years, I had to have the mother board replaced because it failed. Now six months later, my Samsung is dying again. It takes anywhere from 2-5 mins before a picture appears and the light flashes. I can hear a high pitched whistling sound coming from the back of the unit. I purchased this tv for $998 and an extended warranty and because it was one of the highest rated products in consumer report back in 2008. Samsung build quality is very LOW! Will not buy another Samsung HDTV or likely any other product until their build quality is addressed. Would have been satisfied with a life expectancy of 6 years. Would have been happy if it lasted 10 years. I have definitely not logged more than 1,200 hours of using the TV during the 3 years it has been in my possession and LCDs are suppose to have a life expectancy of 40,000-100,000 hours of use. Highly suggest looking into another brand than spending your hard earned money on a Samsung. If you're still hesitant about my review, please google Samsung and you will notice that a majority of their HDTVs from 2008 on have issues.

Reviews.Title: power on issues
Reviews.Author: Sam F. Annibale
Reviews.Content: I have had a 40" samsung hdtv for 2yrs 7 months.  Until recently the tv was greatgood color, sound, clearity.  Recently, the tv takes about 2 to 3 min. to turn on after you hit the power on button. I have read that eventually it will not turn on at all. Many other owners of a samsung tv are experiencing the same peoblems.Called samsung about the problem and they admitted they were having problems with the capacitors, however they would not fix my tv because the waranty is 7 months over coverage.  I called again and complained, talked to supervisors and others to no avail.  All I got was sorry, sorry, sorry.  They told me where I could go to fix the tv.  I think you know where i told them to go.I paid about $500.  for the tv and now its going to cost me $200. to get it fixed after 2 1/2 years.

Reviews.Title: 3 years max
Reviews.Author: monkey "jessicarabbit"
Reviews.Content: Well, three years seems to be the magic number.  This TV has been perfect since we bought it almost exactly three years ago.  A couple of weeks ago, we had a problem where when we went to turn the set on it would turn on, then off, on, off, for several minutes until it finally came on.  We found online that this was a common problem and that it was probably a blown capacitor - a relatively cheap and easy fix.  The repairman I took it to tested it and didn't find any problem with the capacitors, meaning it was most likely a problem with the video card.  That would have cost at least a few hundred dollars to fix.  Once your TV hits the 3-5 year mark, it's an either/or on whether to fix it or buy new.  We decided to cut our losses and just buy a new TV.  We purchased essentially the new version of the same model, but with a 46" screen, for around $400 less than the old one.  Don't pay $900 - $1300 for this TV when you can get a newer, bigger version for the same or less.

Reviews.Title: Expected better Quality from a Samsung
Reviews.Author: C. Burpee
Reviews.Content: This is my First Flat Panel LCD I have ever bought. I did a lot of research online and review sites when I was shopping around for a LCD Tv. I found this TV on sale at my Local Best Buy. The price was in my Budget so I decided to find Reviews On multiple sites such as this one and others and did some homework on the Samsung Brand. I found a lot of positive reviews on it so I decided to buy it. Within the Last 6 months when I watch TV the Screen would Go Black but I could still hear the program. When I turned it off and then Turned it on again the picture would come back only to black out again a couple of minutes later. I tried switching out the Coaxial cable and the Power cables and that didn't work, This would not happen when I played games or watched movies from my PS3 or DVD player, unfortunately as of today I was playing a PS3 game and the screen blacked out more than once when I was playing. I have gone to numerous sites online to see if anyone else was having the same problems I was and low and behold many Samsung Customers we're, not just with my Model tv but different Samsung Models as well. They say it could be a Power Supply problem and could cost $500 or more to fix. I didn't get an Extended Warranty because I only had enough to get the TV. They say that Flat panel TV's are supposed to last about 10 to 15 years. I have a Tube Tv that is 12 years old that is still working as well as when I bought it. Frankly I don't want to take it into a Repair Shop to pay that kind of money to only having it do the same thing again. I gave this Review 2 stars because when the TV worked Properly it gave a great Picture for Games and Movies and HD Television channels. And it is a nice looking Set and the remote control is sturdy and the Menus are easy to follow and the Set itself was easy to set up when I bought it.I have only had this TV a little over 2 years, now I am looking at possibly saving up to buy another Flat panel when I have enough money. I alwasy Dusted every couple of days and it is well ventilated. For anybody else that has this Model of Samsung or any model of Samsung tv I hope that you never encounter this problem or any other Problem and that your TV lasts you a long time. It's a shame because I really liked this TV when it was working Properly. I guess I will have to be more careful when Purchsing and save enough to get an extended warranty on my Next purchase. Sadly enough though It won't be a Samsung TV for me next time.

Reviews.Title: Best $800 Flat Panel LCD I could find
Reviews.Author: Spinner
Reviews.Content: My goal when my old faithful TV finally gave up the ghost was to buy the best $800 TV I could find. I purchased this Samsung on April 7, 2009 for $849 and I am happy to say I think I succeeded. I was lucky that CR magazine just featured flat panel TVs in the March issue and this set ranked third in its class (first was the 42 inch version of the same TV). It's sleek and beautiful.For me, the picture is great. I don't have any HD, but this set's standard definition picture quality makes me believe that HD would be awesome.Audiophiles may not like the sound quality of the speakers, but most of them will channel their sets through surround sound systems anyway.I think this TV is an excellent value and would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Review from College Student just Starting Work
Reviews.Author: Ram Ram
Reviews.Content: I am a recent college graduate starting work this fall. I wanted a good quality LCD tv that would last me for the next decade or so, without breaking my little piggy bank.Price Paid: $820 + tax from AmazonDuration I've Had TV: 2 monthsPROs:*Swivel on TV has a very generous range, which is great for me since I have it in my bedroom and can watch TV from my bed, desk chair, or futon by simply rotating the TV.*Picture Quality: I cannot ask for more from the picture quality. In particular, the color and contrast are amazing and stunning.*Tweaking ability: For those of you who really want to have the most accurate picture quality, this Samsung model lets you tweak everything you need to professional calibrate it. You can google for calibration settings for this model from professionals and then set your TV to these settings and know you have a calibrated TV. You can also use any THX DVD movie you have and goto extra features for the THX calibration on video and sound (e.g. Monsters Inc DVD, Cars DVD, Pirate of Carribean DVD).*Channel Surfing speed: Some LCD tvs take forever to change the channel, not with this model. it is swift. not as fast on my SONY lcd, but fast enough such that you can switch channels without being frustrated at all.*Remote: Samsung has the best remote i have ever seen on a tv. The keys are large and spaced out and intuitive. Also, there is a button on the top that you can press that turns on the light for the keys, which is great! Backlit keys for night time movie watching is amazing!*WiseLink: You can plug into its USB port a camera/jump drive, etc. and it will play a slide show of your pictures and music. Pictures look stunning! A little slow sometimes to read large picture files off plugged in camera, but def bearable.Cons:*Standard Definition channels look like crap on this TV. I have a 6 year old Sony rear projection TV downstairs that processed standard def so much better than this TV. This TV makes standard def. shows look like cell phone clips (quality wise). This would be my biggest gripe on this TV: standard def. sucks so badly.* PIP does not support 2 TV channels (i dont know anybody who would use PIP the way it's setup on this TV; you can only do PIP with another source like PC input with TV. awkward).* Speakers are decent but don't get nearly loud enough for parties or anything beyond personal movie watching. Def. invest in a soundbar or some simple home theater system if you take sound seriously.* Turning the TV on is a little slower than I would like. It needs about 3-5 seconds to fully turn on, and sometimes I'm not sure if i've activated it or not.* Remote must be pointed pretty darn straight at the IR port in order for it to process the signal. Not too annoying but wish they had a more liberal IR range.* USB WiseLink works great for pictures but this model does not support Movies thru its USB port! Need to buy their step-up model to get the movie support on wiselink. I tried to do a firmware update, but there isn't a hack for updating the wiselink to the movie version. May need to buy a WD TV or something to get that movie experience.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful TV until it stopped working
Reviews.Author: Cambridge Amazon Reviewer
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful and sleek TV with a great picture and lots of nice adjustment features. Only problem was that it stopped turning on less than one month after I bought it. Not what you would expect from a $1000 TV.Waiting for a replacement from Amazon right now--I will give Samsung one more try.

Reviews.Title: Somewhat disappointed
Reviews.Author: V. J. Ribaudo "MRGDGT"
Reviews.Content: I was very disaaaponted in this TV.  I had searched around for some time looking for a Samsung that provided an excellent picture and some extras, specifically Pict. In Pict.  While this TV is advertised with this feature, it is never mentioned anywhere that it only works with an Analog signal.  Now Analog signals are are no longer going to be available and in some cases they have already stopped transmitting them. I also contacted Samsung and their response was that is the way the set is designed.  Also the function is buried about 3 layers down in the menu. Not very convenient.  In addition the remote for this TV only works if you were directly in front of the set.  Excellent picture but very poor sound.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful TV
Reviews.Author: n2speed125
Reviews.Content: I have been watching this TV on Amazon for the last 3 months and finally ordered it and received it 4 days later.  I couldn't decide if a 40 inch would be too big for a small sized bedroom but after unboxing it and setting it up, I couldn't be happier. The picture is great. The sound is what I was expecting and I am not at all disappointed. Tried watching regular DVD's and they look great. Xbox 360 games look amazing. Waiting on my HD receiver to be delivered today and I probably won't be leaving the bedroom for the next few days. The price and features can't be beat even by Sony which this TV is now replacing. From the bad reviews I have read about this TV, most seem like user error and/or inexperience with new technology.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Amazonian
Reviews.Content: First, I have to give 5 stars just to Amazon for their excellent service as always (fully supports their great review in a recent Businessweek issue).  The TV shipped quickly and was in my bedroom within 5 working days (the attitude of the delivery person left something to be desired, but I'll leave that out).This TV is for the bedroom and the first day our eyes were hurting thanks to the bright, sharp and vivid picture.  We are used to a 42" in the living room which was a DLP, so this took some getting used to.  After turning down the backlight, it was perfect. I have to admit that I have seen slightly sharper picture, but its usually in TV's that cost at least $400 more (for same size), but for our bedroom it is perfect (and huge).  I prefer to watch TV on this one than my Sony DLP which is also a very high quality HDTV.After doing a lot of research online and seeing the TV in stores, we finally decided to go for this one and glad we did.  You will not regret getting this TV and Amazon has the best price.

Reviews.Title: very pleased
Reviews.Author: A. Motskin
Reviews.Content: Excellent TV. Delivery and setup was on time, quick and professional. Amazon rocks. You can't beat Amazon's price, especially compared to traditional brick and mortar stores.I will say that I'm a bit overwhelmed with all of the calibration options on the TV -- I'd appreciate guidance (from Samsung or whoever) on the best way to tweak these options...

Reviews.Title: looks great, works great
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I replaced my 37" Olevia with this Samsung model and after one month, have been extremely pleased.1) The LCD screen is vibrant and sharp, using a progressive scan up-converting DVD player or HDTV broadcasts.  I haven't felt the need to invest in Blue-ray yet as I am completely satisfied with my current picture.2) The DTV tuner works much better than the old Olevia (I use a simple rabbit ears to pull in  crystal clear HDTV broadcasts).3) Channels change quickly, though it is good to go through and siphon out unwanted TV stations from the channel list after scanning as this box will pick up a few dozen digital broadcast TV stations.4) The delivery service that Amazon contracts carried the box in, set it up, and verified that it works, quickly and without problem.5) The HDMI connection works great with both my Sony and Denon up-converting DVD players.  I've tried both.

Reviews.Title: Horrible shipping company, great product.
Reviews.Author: Bryan Farrington "Bryan Farrington"
Reviews.Content: The television is gorgeous and works very well. The audio quality of the TV, which has been an issue for some review writers, is really not an issue unless you are an audiophile, in which case you probably have surround sound and it really becomes a non-issue. The sound quality is completely adjustable if you feel you need to tinker with it.As for the shipper, CEVA promised that my TV would arrive on a certain day and then it did not. Amazon was willing to compensate me 10% of the purchase price in an amazon gift card. I ended up getting it a week after it was supposed to be there. Not Amazon's fault, but they took the fall.

Reviews.Title: Samsung has done it again
Reviews.Author: Kyle R. Hudson "scottishsurfer"
Reviews.Content: I shopped around for a long time, but finally came to the conclusion that with all variables taken into account (size, contrast ratio, response time, cost) a Full HD, 1080p Samsung with 30,000:1 contrast ratio at the price you can find this at (less than $800 if you look around) is simply outstanding.Bottom line: The price to product ratio for 40" Samsungs is 5-star.  The price differential for televisions even slightly larger just isn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 40" LCDTV
Reviews.Author: David W. McReaken "britcar driver"
Reviews.Content: This is our first HDTV set and we did a lot of research before ordering it, not only on line but at local retailers as well.  The only adverse comment we saw was on sound quality.  It is no worse than a lot of other TVs.  I'm sure it would be great with a home theatre setup, the problem seems to be the tiny speakers.The delivery and set up are worth mentioning.  They called and made an appointment and came within the alloted time, unpacked and set up the TV.  They tested the TV to make sure it worked properly, and offered the option of us keeping the packing or them taking it and disposing of it.  Great service and proof against shipping damage or manufacturer's defect at the time of delivery.

Reviews.Title: Perfect HDTV for someone just wanting a TV!!!!
Reviews.Author: Ryan K. Brown "BrownBagga"
Reviews.Content: I bought the HDTV for my grandparents 4 weeks ago and they don't have a single complaint.  Granted it lacks the 120hz and the LED backlight but it still looks amazing especially if this is your first HighDef experience.  So if your in the market for a HDTV and all you want to do is basically plug and play and maybe change picture settings then this is the flat panel for you.

Reviews.Title: Delivery and Sound
Reviews.Author: George N. Schlenker
Reviews.Content: White glove service went well, a call to set up delivery time came and was honored, but the delivery person had no idea that he was responsible for unpacking, setting and ensuring the item worked.As another review advised, the sound is not good. For those who will set up an independent sound system, this does not matter.Other than that, the television is very good.George

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV, Great delivery service
Reviews.Author: K. Greene
Reviews.Content: I just got this TV last night and it is gorgeous. The picture is great even though I don't have HD. It's a big improvement over the LCDs from 2-3 years ago when I tried out a Phillips that kept resizing the images to fit the screen. The TV itself is also beautiful and doesn't stick out like a sore thumb like a lot of TVs do. I have it in a dark entertainment center and you can hardly even see it when it's off.I was pretty surprised by the delivery service. The estimated arrival was a week from when I made the order. Instead I got it less than 48 hours later. The delivery guy was helpful and careful. He even helped me move my old TV even though he said he wasn't "supposed to". Of course the service will be specific to the location, but in Albuquerque they seem to have a good thing going.

Reviews.Title: Great TV and great purchase experience
Reviews.Author: Happy Retiree
Reviews.Content: Samsung LN40A550 40-Inch 1080p LCD HDTVThis was my first experience purchasing a major product on Amazon.  Everything went smooth and the TV was delivered about a day later than expected.  "White Glove" delivery was made by CEVA directly to my door.  It was unpacked and set up on my entertainment center cabinet, cables hooked up and turned on by the person delivering it.  All done very quickly and professionally.  So far I am pleased with this Samsung TV except that I am disappointed that the ANYNET+ is not compatible with the ANYNET on my older model Samsung Home Entertainment (means I can't use the same remote to control both pieces).  That is the only reason for the 4 star rating instead of 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: The new standard of HD
Reviews.Author: G-off S.
Reviews.Content: I would just like to say that this is the first product of any kind that I purchased on amazon.com.  I read the reviews, both positive and negative, and have come away amazingly impressed with this television!I received it two days ahead of the estimated delivery date, and was able to set up my xbox360, ps3, and wii with ease (yes, I am a game-geek.)  I have read that the built-in speakers aren't the best, or worse, that they are dreadful.  I would have to say that they are pretty decent for the size and positioning of them.  I, however, use a separate audio receiver so it was a non-issue for me.I was able to scan antenna and cable right out of the box and get over a dozen free HD stations!  This is truly a fantastic TV.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Television - Love it!
Reviews.Author: a reader in Albuquerque
Reviews.Content: I have never purchased such a big ticket item over the Internet.  I was greatly pleased with the white glove service and how soon after I placed the order that the local delivery company phoned me to deliver my tv the next day.  The television setup was quick and easy, pretty much just turn it on.  The picture with my satellite receiver (not HD) is wonderful, and crystal clear.  For Christmas the family purchased a Sony Playstation 3 (again off of Amazon).  The picture using the HDMI input is amazing!  We played a movie the other day using the Ps3 and were blown away by the clarity of the picture.  I rated this item a 5 star because of the brilliant picture quality; however, if I have one complaint it would be the sound is not as loud as I would want it to be, but really it is not that much of an issue.  Other reviewers also mentioned the sound, but as I've said it is not a huge deal and it does not affect my giving it a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: Crisp picture out of the box
Reviews.Author: Richard E. Mudd IV "richardmudd"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this set after reading the Consumer Reports recommendation, and what impressed me the most was the performance right out of the box.  I simply took the TV out, hooked it up and the picture is beautiful.  The TV seems to handle motion well, and the HD is perfect.If I could give it 4.5 stars I would due to the sound.  Without a hook-up to a sound system, the sound is hollow at low volume... increasing the volume seems to eliminate the problem...

Reviews.Title: Close, but not quite there
Reviews.Author: FWA Brookfield, WI
Reviews.Content: The TV was pretty much as promised. The set up was straight forward and quick. The picture is outstanding. The two complaints are sound quality and the remote control operation. I read the reviews about the less than stellar sound quality and purchased anyhow figuring it cant be that bad. Well it pretty much is. Very flat and not fitting a set of its otherwise very good quality. Why they designed this set to have the speakers in lower back side projecting rearward is beyond me as well. The remote has to be pretty much perpendicular to the front middle of the set for the signal to be recognized. Any deviation left or right or up and down and the it wont work. A little frustrating when used in any other seating position in my family room but one chair head on. My 32' Toshiba Regza has much better sound and remote function

Reviews.Title: Very happy
Reviews.Author: trentula77
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with this TV.  I researched for quite some time on which LCD TV is the best out there for quality and value.  Amazon had the best price out there for the Samsung LN40A550.  It has an awesome picture and great sound for my expectations.  The only minor complaint I have about this TV is with the remote.  You have to point the remote right at the "eye" of the TV in the lower right hand corner or else it wont pick up the signal.  Kinda annoying but so what now I have to move my hand a cm to point directly at the "eye"....no big deal.

Reviews.Title: All that I hoped it would be
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The Samsung LN40A550 40-inch 1080p LCD HDTV is a great product.  The picture is stunning, even not in HD. I would not buy a tv online except from Amazon.  Great price and free shipping.  We were very happy with the delivery and the delivery person, too. He got it out of the box and set it up for us. He did not leave until after he saw it was working. So much easier than getting tv locally and lugging it home. Only thing confusing was whether there was a remote with the set, or if you had to buy one to go with it.  Took a chance not ordering one, and a remote did arrive with it.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely loving it
Reviews.Author: zyu-man
Reviews.Content: I had this Samsung LCD TV for about month now and I absolutely love it.The quality is great. I have Verizon Fios at home and all HD Channels come out great.The delivery was really fast too, I received in 3 days.I will definitely recommend buying Samsung LCD TV through Amazon.com to anyone I know.

Reviews.Title: Superb picture quality
Reviews.Author: krads
Reviews.Content: This tv has superb picture quality with digital cable and PS3 games.  The picture quality is not as good with a regular analog signal.  Overall I am extremely staisfied with this tv.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal
