Reviews.Author: T. Wilson "oldman"
Reviews.Content: This is the second Samsung (40" & 52")from Amazon. It had a great picture, but the sound is not so great. I uses a sound system and not the tv speakers.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased Customer
Reviews.Author: Up2NoGood0 "Up2NoGood0"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item 11/17/2008; I received it the morning of 11/22/2008. I would have to say I'm very pleased with the amount of time it took to get to my front door. This TV came with free shipping so I couldn't go wrong. Like all of you I read many reviews and do countless hours of research before I purchase something, especially something I have not seen with my own eyes, so I count on all of you. I'm hoping my review will help the inquisitive people out there on this product. I used to be a huge Sony fan, I mean huge!! I was at Best Buy one day several months ago a bought a Panasonic plasma. I was very excited it was a 46" Vera, or whatever they are called. I hooked it up, put it on the wall and I was so disappointed with the picture. I took the TV back the next day. I was looking at Samsungs (LCD) and noticed the LN40a650. I was very impressed, but not with the price. I learned something new that day. I learned about 120Hz fresh. Little spendy for my blood, but fell in love with it. I decided to purchase it, but of course it was not in stock, but they found it at another store. I jumped in my truck and drove to it. When I got there I saw my TV in a box sitting under the 52" version of mine. It was marked about $400 less then the other store. I had to get it. I got this TV home (LN52A650) hooked it up threw it on the wall and I was complete. My girlfriend purchased a blue ray that day. Sony BDP-300 which made picture jump out at me. I was so impressed and I'm pretty much an electronics geek. I was finally pleased. Anything I plugged into this TV I was happy. My point is Samsung rock. I would have to say better than Sony. Sony is good, but way over priced. For the person that is looking for a great TV grab the ln52a650 you will be pleased. Ok, Back to this TV. Its not 120 Hz refresh, but it does a great job. I am very pleased with it. This TV went right in my bedroom. I have to express the importance of going to Samsungs web site and updating the firmware right away. Be sure to follow the directions. There are currently two updates for this TV. 1005 and 1006. Grab a flash disk and get it done. I have read people having issues with things in the past models. Get the TV to date. It will work great. I just added a firmware update to my 650 made the film mode more realistic. This TV is just as good minus the 120 Hz refresh. If your looking for quality grab this TV if you're like me you will be very content. Oh by the way back to the blue ray. DO NOT get the 300 series go up to the 350 with the Sony its alot faster start up, you can hook it up to the internet for the firmware updates and it will put out in HD Audio.

Reviews.Title: The most amazing investment in my entire life...
Reviews.Author: Arvind Raghavan
Reviews.Content: This TV is simply an amazing piece of engineering. It looks good, performs good and is definitely my best investment by far!!!Before I had got this, I was researching a lot about the various specs that this TV has.... It had a good Dynamic contrast ratio(30000:1), a response time (5ms) and the best resolution available as of today (1080p)...Boy, I'm glad that I went for this set. I compared this with a few other TV sets that my friends had( all were 1080p, brands: Vizio and Sharp 42" TVs) and only then did I really know why every one insists on Contrast ratio.. Man the black in this TV are so black and the picture quality is crystal clear. Sound, out of the box was definitely an issue, however, with a few adjustments (search google for "best sound setting on Samsung LN40A550" and you can find a few links that have images of their custom sound settings. Believe me, it makes a huuuuuuuuuuge difference and now I'm more than happy with my TV's sound quality)I went for the Verizon's FIOS TV for cable and the clarity of the channels is just out of this world.After seeing all these things, I just wonder how the higher models in Samsung would perform (one with 100000:1 contrast ratio). People who own those should be ever more luckier and satisfied. If I ever think of getting a bigger TV, I'll close my eyes and go for a Samsung. Kudos to Samsung for making millions of their customers happy.Don't even hesitate buying this TV.. You wont be disappointed for sure.Have fun....

Reviews.Title: Review for 40' Samsung HD tv
Reviews.Author: Juan El Gordo
Reviews.Content: We are very pleased with the 40' HD TV we got through Amazon. Two minor exceptions are the sound quality and the loss of quality picture when viewing from an angle. Otherwise, the set is great. I was aghast at all the wires that are behind my set, but I guess this is true of any such TV,

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Great Price
Reviews.Author: A. Olesen
Reviews.Content: I am not a TV expert. I did my homework, and this came out to be the best TV in the range I was looking at ($1000-$1200). I originally intended to buy a bigger TV, but the quality of the Samsung product swayed me. My only complaints are that it attracts dust, it is slow to turn on (or give you any sign that it is in the process of turning on), and there is only a VGA connection for your computer, not a true DVI input. But the picture is great, sound is fine but it is only internal speakers.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Kane and Abel "Jeff"
Reviews.Content: A very good LCD TV with all the features I was looking for,excellent for the price.Am very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT LOOK ANY MORE- YOU HAVE FOUND IT!
Reviews.Author: Kathryn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are just regular people looking for a replacement TV for our living room. We don't know or even understand all the fancy terminology or the inputs, cables, components, etc. that now come with buying a TV. We are actually "old school" people that just watch our TV, so understand that our expectations are for picture quality and value alone. We stood in front of many TV's and searched on-line for months before purchasing, and we are absolutely thrilled with the quality and the cost. My sister has a Samsung 42" 720, and I cannot believe how much better it looks than hers (plus they bought at a much, much higher price about a year and half ago)!! So get it and enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: M. Brown "Herping Pathologist"
Reviews.Content: I have had the TV for almost two months and it has worked wonderfully thus far.  The clarity of it in comparisson to other major brands is what sold me.  No complaints here.

Reviews.Title: It's a winner!
Reviews.Author: R. Cherye "rcherye"
Reviews.Content: Samsung LN40A550 40-Inch 1080p LCD HDTVI did a lot of research before selecting this LCD HD TV and it's lived up to my expectations.  Great picture and viewing angles; lots of inputs and outputs; and a well designed remote that allows chnging source, picture view aspect, and captioning without going through menus.  Only downside is PIP only works between analog and digital inputs (i.e. not two analog inoputs).  But that problem goes away as I replace my analog components with digital ones.

Reviews.Title: MB
Reviews.Author: Horn Blower
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV.  I agree that the sound could be better, but it can be improved if you make adjustments with the onboard equalizer.  I got it ahead of schedule and had no problems with delivery even though I live in a fairly rural area.  OK, I'll admit my red-neck delivery guy didn't wear white gloves, but the set got here safely, and is working perfectly!

Reviews.Title: Perfect Television
Reviews.Author: Dolf
Reviews.Content: I did extensive research before I bought this TV. Went to Best Buy to view some different models, checked out Consumer Reports for ratings, and read many reviews online. I'm very happy with it. Amazon shipped it quickly...the shipping company called the day before to make sure someone would be home. (Always have the shipper open the package before leaving your home so you can look over your TV for any damages.) There are plenty of adjustable color features to fine tune the picture to your space...which is something all stores do to optimize the picture under the store lights. If you're looking for a 40" LCD this TV is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: Review of Samsung 40" LN40A550
Reviews.Author: Al D.
Reviews.Content: Fast shipping.  Great Price. Great picture and features. Only disappointment is the sound from the speakers is poor.  I needed to hook up a home theater system to get better sound. In doing so I lost the automatic sound level feature that keeps the volume of commercials level.

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: R. Damery
Reviews.Content: Colors are vivid and accurate.  Computer, video games and blu-ray looks great.  Sounds isn't that bad, but isn't perfect.  Great tv for the price!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: A. Santos
Reviews.Content: This is my first entry into the HDTV world, and I am very pleased with this TV. My Xbox 360 looks fantastic on it, I only wish I had more HD channels to take advantage of this display. The SD quality isn't great, but it's tolerable.

Reviews.Title: Great LCD perfect picture but lacks on sound
Reviews.Author: W. Carrabine "Logan"
Reviews.Content: On a overall this is a great 1080p lcd tv. The picture is top notch like all of samsung tv's it has plenty of hdmi inputs and a great remote and instruction manual. My only complaint with this model is the sound from the tv itself is a bit tinny and lacks depth. This can be improved through the on screen menu for those who do not have a home theater surround system.This tv though does make you feel you need to purchase a home theater system to fully enjoy it though. I have bought 3  different models of lcd's from samsung and I have not been disappointed with any of them. It's just as the  saying goes the better the model the better the quality and features in such cases as this one.Like my higher model of this one but 46 inches and my other one has the touch of red color also you need to download the newest firmware to a usb drive and plug it in the usb port on the lcd and upgrade the firmware. Outside of that the Samsung lcd's are top notch and amazon stands by the products and are very helpful.Plus online buying is much cheaper than going to the big box stores that charge you more for items like this to offset their overhead.

Reviews.Title: one gorgeous television (Samsung LN40A550)
Reviews.Author: Michael James King "MKinghome"
Reviews.Content: Super nice television. Picture is amazing; the complaints about the sound being muted by some reviewers puzzle me---it sounds great to us. Also, bought a few HDMI cables from Amazon to hookup my BlueRay player, and our Dishnet DVR. Its a tossup whether this makes any difference with the Dishnet setup (that's 1080i at best), but the HDMI connect to the Playstation3 (blueray within) pops our eyes and ears.This unit is 60hz and the 120hz would've been a couple hundred more I believe. The professional reviewers and others didn't notice a picture quality problem with 'slow' refresh rate and we haven't either.Registering the product with Samsung extends the warranty by 3 months BTW.I bought this using my Amazon card with free financing for 24 mos. Included in the tax free price was "white glove" delivery (they bring it in, set it up, test sound and picture). The following week I noticed the price on this tv had dropped rather dramatically and brought this to Amazon's attention. The rep told me they don't have a price guarantee, but since it had dropped so quickly Amazon gave me a partial rebate. I'm happy. I guess the 120hz would've been sweet, but 'just because' (just because ..........).

Reviews.Title: Excellent HD TV, outstanding picture quality
Reviews.Author: Robert C. McLafferty "Tech lover"
Reviews.Content: This is my very first purchase of a major electronic device via the internet.  Knowing that Amazon is a top quality seller along with the Samsung reputation I decided to purchase this HD tv after spending a lot of time in search of the "perfect" product.  As soon as I had ordered the HD tv I contacted my cable provider and aranged to have them complete the setup the day after it was delivered.  The pros of this HD tv is the picture quality is superior to what I had hoped and watching sports supplies a new dimension to that experience.  The con is that the sound quality as noted in other reviews does lend to some concerns, however after a few days I have gotten used to the sound and is not that big of an issue to me.  The delivery of this HD tv was actually two days earlier than the date provided at the time of the order which was a big plus for us.  This was Another quality product and shopping experience for us with Amazon.In the event you may not have already surmised this I highly recommend both this Samsung HD tv as well as purchasing it from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Bruce E. Buttrey
Reviews.Content: The unit was repacked but immaculate. It provides an excellent picture when hooked to an HD source. The picture is a bit disappointing when it is not HD. I would definetly make this purchase again. I also own a sony bravia that is fantastic. I would however, purchase the Samsung instead for the difference in price.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Greg Machamer
Reviews.Content: I picked this tv model over it's newer ones specifically because of the matte finish that the screen has.  I have this tv in a room with a double sliding glass door directly across from it.  While I won't say there is not any glare when it is bright outside, there is less glare then any TV I have ever owned.Not only that, but the picture quality is wonderful.  The sound is about the same as you will find on any TV.  Meaning if you like to watch movies and sports you are probably going to be buying a receiver to pair up with this, so you don't really care about the sound.  I'm online right now buying the HT-S7100 from onkyo.

Reviews.Title: I love my TV
Reviews.Author: M. Thor "Iceyred"
Reviews.Content: I am in love...this TV is fabulous and exceptional...I noticed many people talking about the sound quality...but i guess Im pretty simple...i think once i found the right setting....the sound was just fine...i was expecting absolutely horrible but still willing to purchase because the picture quality was outstanding...I love this TV and the 24 months no interest is great...id recommend signing up if you can. I have this TV in a nice small place between 2 windows and i receive no glare...the cats love it alot as well...Months ago i bought a monitor by samsung....i wont by any other brand. Picture is great...i like the sleek remote...im ok with the sound...now all i need is a super comfy couch to keep me infront of the TV more!!! Highly Recommend and perfect fit for the size of my space...aprox 15x15.

Reviews.Title: Definitely the Right Tele
Reviews.Author: E. Cruz Eusebio
Reviews.Content: PROS: Brilliant picture, Attractive shell, 3 HDMIs, 1080p.CONS: I think I want a bigger one.

Reviews.Title: Don't be scared by CEVA shipping!
Reviews.Author: Jonathan A. Young
Reviews.Content: I ordered the TV on Tuesday night, and Thursday morning it is already in Detroit.  I can either pick it up today or they will deliver tomorrow morning.  I called CEVA a few times and they were very professional and helpful.  I will review the TV once I get it.

Reviews.Title: Smaller than exected.
Reviews.Author: No Place like Home
Reviews.Content: I have a 36" sharp regular t.v. that is huge in my small apt, so when I ordered this 40" I expected to be as large or larger, but it wasn't.  The television was smaller but the picture is great and so far so good on unit quality.  I've had the t.v. about a month now with no problems.  Sound quality is perfect for me, but I think if you are planning to place the set in a large room, you'll need a sound system.

Reviews.Title: Excellent purchase, great shipping service
Reviews.Author: Pratik
Reviews.Content: After a lot of debating, this was my first online big ticket purchase.  I bought this over a Vizio from CC, which was over $300 cheaper!  And I do not regret the decision.  The picture quality is amazing.  The sound is also very good.  Lots of inputs at the back. What more can you ask?The shipping service, CEVA was a mixed experience.  The called the day they received the TV and I setup a time within 30 mins for them to come to my house.  The guy opened the TV and put it where I wanted it.  He then had me inspect the TV and switched it on.  There were no defects, needless to say!  However, 3 days after that I received a 2nd call from CEVA asking about scheduling an appointment for delivery of the TV!!  How can that be, I had already received my TV.  Maybe they were giving me a 2nd TV??  I told them I had already received it and hung up!The only weird thing about this TV (and maybe others, or maybe with my cable box - TWC) is that when changing channel from (HD <-> SD) it blanks out for a sec. Kinda similar to what a PC monitor does when you change resolution.  Dont know if others have noticed this, or is a 'feature' of HD TVs.

Reviews.Title: Love the Samsung
Reviews.Author: Earl R. Wilt
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the TV. Great picture especially in HD. Non-HD channels actually look worse than a regular tv. Not sure why. It's not this tv's fault, I think they're all like that. Nice looking set. Works great with plugging in a laptop computer and surfing the net etc. hooking up a digital camera and viewing pics in high res, also easy to hook up games etc. PS2 games don't take advantage of the 1080 res, so they actually don't look that great, like regular tv broadcast. I think a PS3 or Xbox 360 would need to be used to get the full effect. Took the stand off and mounted it to a wall, which was pretty easy. Bought a Sony HTCT 100 which improved the sound greatly. I don't use the internal speakers. Not that great. Try the Sony. Amazon had an excellent price and the unit was delivered quickly and taken out of the box by the delivery men.Highly recommended! Will buy more Samsungs in the future.

Reviews.Title: Some Surprises
Reviews.Content: Have had this TV for about a month now.  Amazon delivery was great.  They took it out of the box, hooked it up and tried it to make sure it worked with no problems.  Could tell they were in a hurry but that is understandable.  They did what was necessary and I am completely satisfied with  the delivery.The TV operates great no real problems.  There seems to be a great variation in quality of signals coming in.  I am hooked up with HDMI.  HD channels are great but hard to watch SD after watching the HD.  SD is nothing to brag about.  My viewing distance is usually about 6 feet as I watch most of the time from my computer chair.  Sitting a couple feet farther away does help with the SD.  6 feet is fine for HD.  I was pleasantly surprised by a couple things.  The sound is much better than I thought it would be after reading all the negative reviews.  A tip to others, there are 5 settings for audio you can try.  They are Standard, Music, Movie,Speech and Custom.  Check those out to find which one sounds the best to you. Check "Equalizer" and you will see what the settings are for each. Use the best settings as a starting point and use the "Custom" setting to fine tune.  Worked for me.  Also I am surprised at the quality of the video from a sharp angle.  It is just as good as our 50 inch Plasma Panasonic.  Overall I am very satisfied with this TV, it works great with my new compact Samsung DVD player and also flawlessly with my JVC VHS player.  I give 4 stars because I think the SD should be better but it may be the quality of the signals.  HD is  Excellent with satellite signal and also Excellent with over-the-air local channels.  The Olympics were fantastic with over-the air HD.

Reviews.Title: Great HDTV at great price
Reviews.Author: K. Yu "baconwrappedreviews"
Reviews.Content: I've had the LN40A550 for over a month now, and though it's only been in use for a week -- so far so good.  I did a lot of homework before purchasing this TV and it seemed that generally, Samsung's Series 5,6 and 7 HDTVs receive some of the best overall reviews.  Though I haven't been able to fully take advantage of all its features, particularly the 1080p mode, I have used the unit with Comcast HDTV cable and also hooked it up to my laptop.  I believe my HD channels come in at 1080i and the picture quality is great.  The picture from the laptop also is amazing.  I will be purchasing a Blu-ray player in the upcoming months to fully take advantage of the 1080p.Many of the reviews on this TV unit complain about the sound.  I'm a bit of sound system snob (for my car, PC, home theatre, etc) and these reviews and complaints about the sound on the LN40A550 are right... to a degree.  What people have to understand is that in order to have a full rich sound, speakers need size and depth, which HDTVs do not allow due to their thin sizes.  Bigger, deeper speakers (i.e. those found in old CRT units and external speakers) typically provide richer, fuller sounds.  Simply think of the difference when comparing the sound that comes from a laptop to the sound that comes out of desktop computers with external speakers.  When considering these facts, I'm actually pretty impressed by the sound this unit produces and don't believe the complaints are justified.  Furthermore, the unit provides multiple sound settings, and selecting the correct setting for what you are watching makes a significant difference.  But I will be adding a home theatre system to really take advantage of the HDTV experience.I am very satisfied with my purchase and hopefully, the product will be as reliable as everyone claims it to be, since I did not purchase the extended warranty.  Though I have no other HDTVs to compare this to, I do highly recommend this unit.

Reviews.Title: Great Product with a bonus
Reviews.Author: Russell
Reviews.Content: I have owned this set for one month and have nothing but praise for it. I purchased this set from Amazon, and it was shipped quickly. The CEVA personnel unpacked and hooked it up. They waited while I inspected the set to make sure it worked properly and that there were no defective pixels. There weren't any.The picture is top notch. I recently visited a friend who had a new Sony HDTV. While the picture on his set was very nice, I did notice that the blacks seem much deeper on the Samsung. It seems to me, that the colors, in general, are a bit richer on the Samsung than they are on the Sony.I have seen many comments complaining about the sound. If you're expecting a top rate sound experience you might be disappointed. However, the sound on this set is better than on the set I replaced. Compared to my friend's Sony, I didn't notice any appreciable difference in the sound. Of course, that might be my old ears not being able to tell the difference. If I feel the need for better sound, I'll purchase a sound system. I think most people who want the best sound experience do this anyway.This set apparently has a built in QAM tuner. Although I have not seen it specifically stated that it has this feature, the owners manual states that you can receive HD-digital channels without a set-top box. What that means is you can receive non-scrambled HD digital channels having only a regular (non-digital) cable subscription. The number of channels will vary from area to area. Some providers may scramble all HD-digital channels. If this is the case, this feature will not work. In my area, the local channels are not scrambled and can be viewed in HD.I was not aware of this fact when I purchased the set. I think others may also be surprised to learn this. So there you go, free HD. That's a nice little bonus I did not expect.

Reviews.Title: Pretty spiffy!
Reviews.Author: Emily
Reviews.Content: I've always liked Samsung products and this was no exception.  I think this is the highest quality you can get for the money.  I debated sizes for quite awhile but am extremely happy with the 40".  I feel it's very versatile for different rooms.  It currently sits in my living room where we watch it at a distance of about eight feet.Some reviews say the sound quality is poor and while I admit it's not like having real speakers, I think it's acceptable.  While I wouldn't say I'm an authority on sound, I am a music teacher and still possess a great amount of hearing.The picture is very clear, be it DVDs, stations picked up over the air (yes, I'm using rabbit ears...too cheap for cable), or video games.  My wii looks very nice in HD, as does the ps2.Delivery was exceptional.  The TV was delivered four days after my order and the delivery man set it up and confirmed that it worked.  They even were very flexible with the delivery, working with my work schedule and giving me a 2 1/2 hour window instead of the standard four.Also, I must say I love Amazon's 30 day price guarantee.  So far I've shaved $20 off the original price I paid.  I hope I'm not annoying Amazon too much by calling in for a $1.93 price change :)Great TV, great price.  The remote is pretty nice too.

Reviews.Title: technology ahead of its time
Reviews.Author: Scott Kendall Mcfadden
Reviews.Content: Great TV.  Sharp picture and color.  My main beef is that TV technology is now ahead of most content provider technology.  Cox Cable HD content appears great on this TV so long as its relatively still.  Any kind of fast motion and you get compression related jaggies.  The NBC-HD olympics is a prime example.  The apply so much compression to the signal that any fast motion is very jaggy.  I hear that OTA HD doesnt have this problem but OTA doesn't have ESPN  :(For now, guess I will have to go purchase a BD-Player for good quality HD content.

Reviews.Title: Everything I expected, but definitely room for improvement
Reviews.Author: K. Peluso
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that this is an excellent tv. We replaced our 4+ year old 34" Sony Trinitron XRB 1080i with this. The picture coming from a Blueray disc from a PS3 in 24p mode is outstanding.The free shipping from Amazon (freight truck) took only 2 days; a lot less that we had expected.The are only two things I'd like to see different. The first is the audio system as other reviewers have touched upon. Our 55" Sony lcd does make this set's sound system seem very lacking. If this were going to be my main tv for seriously watching movies, Id absolutely bypass the built-in speakers and utilize a real sound system.The second change Id like to see, and this isnt specific to this set, I still dont get why any manufacturer I've seen can't get the source selection editor right. What I mean is when you switch from cable/satellite to dvd or game etc, you cannot turn off the need to pass through the option to select the built-in tuner. This is just a pet peeve of mine but I honestly cant remember the last time I actually used a connection that didnt use a signal from another device.Overall, Id highly recommend this set. Upgrade the sound system and it gets 5 stars. Definitely play the waiting game with Amazon to get the best price as it does fluctuate. I paid $40 more than if I would have ordered the day before, but paid less that the sale price two days later.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: Joan
Reviews.Content: This TV is the best!  Has a great picture, great color looks good.  There is easy access to the hook ups in the back.  I can't say enough good things about the delivery and set up.  How easy can it get!  Arrived way ahead of schedule was brought into the house, unpacked and set up to make sure all was well.  And after all that I saved about $400.00 on this purchase.  Would certainly recommend to anyone in the market for a new TV.

Reviews.Title: Re:  Samsung 1080p8 Upscaling DVD player compatability
Reviews.Author: David S. Griffie "drazzle89"
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the LN40A550 and the 1080p8 Upscaling DVD player. Unlike the post below, I haven't had any problems in relation to the Anynet signal appearing every couple of minutes. I plugged in the DVD player into the HDMI 2 jack, put in a DVD, and immediately started watching. I've heard of some issues with the TV and needing additional firmware, but so far I haven't needed it. I've had my TV for three weeks now and have never had a problem with the DVD player losing a signal or connection.I narrowed my choices between the Sony and the Samsung and thought the Samsung outperformed the Sony. Sony tends to create a picture that is extremely soft, much like the look in the movie theatres. I'm not saying this is a bad thing, but I tend like more crispness and definition.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN40A550 LCD
Reviews.Author: B. P. Olson
Reviews.Content: I've exhaustively researched LCD TV's for the better part of two years. The prices have finally leveled off, and Samsung has pretty much risen to the top as far as value, quality of picture and overall ease of use. I've had the LN40A550 for about a month now and can't be happier. The picture is beautiful especially in HD and DVD's. Standard TV is a little degraded which is expected but by no means any big deal at all. If you can subscribe to an HD service, DO IT!!, it's amazing. I listened through TV's speakers initially and was impressed with sound quality, so if your not hell bent on total home theater experience you'll be very happy with stock TV speakers. Don't really see the need for 120Hz, I've seen no motion issues at all and I watch a lot of sports (Olympics in HD have been unreal). Overall it's hard to find anything bad to say about this TV, you won't be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: Great television, price, and service!
Reviews.Author: April May "april12"
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research on tv's prior to purchasing this model.  I was deciding between a Samsung and a Sony.  I went with the Samsung as it had excellent reviews.  Amazon listed the price cheaper than Best Buy, Circuit City, Sears, etc...and those store will prob. not match Amazon prices.  The television is exactly what I wanted.  The picture is excellent and it has many features.  Movies look great.  I do agree with others that the sound quality is not the greatest but I'm willing to overlook.  Amazon's white glove service is tops as well.  I got it less than a week after I ordered it - and they came and plugged everything in.  It was great.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Robin Silva
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV after doing a bit of shopping online and stores. In stores Sony matched Samsung in picture quality and was better in sound. However it seems that the TVs were not plugged via HDMI in the store I checked. However Samsung's price tag swung it for me. I think Sony and Samsung beat the likes on Sharp, Vizio etc hands down in picture quality.  Ordering was easy and I got credit when the price fell further. The TV was delivered one day ahead of schedule. I am in California and the order status showed waiting on customer even though no one from Ceva had called me. When I called them, they said they usually call in later in the day. They came right on time and delivered and set it up for me. Really good service no complaints at all. I connected my comcast box to my TV and I got crisp picture. The standard definition channels are OK but HD channels are really good. I tried connecting my box to TV via coaxial cable, HDMI and component video. HDMI is the thing! Picture quality is better with HDMI than component (I may be mixing the terms here, this one had three video and two audio wires). One thing to note was how much difference HDMI made to the sound quality. if you think your sound with Samsung is bad, try HDMI connections. I have not really tried tuning the picture settings as yet and I am fine with the factory settings so far.I have watched some action movies via comcast and I did not notice the blur as such. The black levels look good. The TV comes with a swivel stand which is convenient for me. I am very happy with this TV and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING TV!
Reviews.Author: Anonymous "anonymous"
Reviews.Content: We were worried about the sound quality when we chose the Samsung because of one bad review. NO PROBLEM. It is great on low or high. The picture quality is awesome and so are the other features. Can't believe we can have a slide show on the TV! We love this set!! Everyone is mesmerized by the incredible HD picture. We received our order from Amazon in only 3 days plus the man brought it right into our den and unpacked it. Wonderful service, we could not be more pleased!

Reviews.Title: Mind boggling picture, sound not so much..
Reviews.Author: PadPDA "PaddyPDA"
Reviews.Content: It's been about 2 months since I have this TV. This is my first HDTV and wow what a transition. Even before I upgraded my cable to HD, I was pleasantly surprised to see this Samsung TV pick up the local HD channels through the QAM tuner. Anyway, the picture quality is mind boggling with true colors and great black levels. I am a bit annoyed with the dynamic contrast which prompted me to turn this feature off. There is enough number of I/O ports and the swivel base makes it more convenient. I compared this with the Sony TVs and decided to go ahead with this for more bang for buck. The shipping service was great, the CEVA folks unpacked and setup the TV to make sure it's working. Amazon's 30 day price guarantee is also great and I received a couple of refunds when the price fell down.The sound on the other hand is quite disappointing. I'd say it's just about OK for general viewing but woefully inadequate for movie/sports watching. Somehow with the entertainment center I have the sound seems to be directed more toward the back than to the front. I think it's a given fact that most of the newer TVs on the market need home theater systems, except maybe the higher end models. I just got myself a Samsung HT-TWZ412H and it's so much better. The ANYNET feature worked like a breeze through the HDMI and the TV remote controls the sound on the home theater setup. I connected the cable box to the home theater using an optical cable.SD channels on this HDTV look like crap, so much that I've completely stopped watching SD channels.All in all the TV is great but if it fits the budget, you'll have to seriously consider getting yourself a home theater to up your experience.

Reviews.Title: great deal
Reviews.Author: A. Novice
Reviews.Content: We have had our Samsung 550 for just over two weeks now and are very satisfied. The delivery was excellent with great help setting it up in our family room.We use cable and are still adjusting to the dual remotes since we control the picture with the Samsung remote and the channels and sound with our cable remote.It is the best deal we have seen for this model.

Reviews.Title: Great TV - not entirely happy with the delivery service
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: First let me say the TV is incredible!  I have hooked it up to my cable box via HDMI and the picture is perfect!  I've also hooked up my Wii HD and have hooked my laptop into it which you can view at extremely high resolution.My problem was mostly with the delivery service and the "white glove" gaurantee.  Let me start by saying that luckily there was no problem with the TV regarding pixels.  However, when it was delivered, they barely brought it in and then just left.  They are SUPPOSED TO help you set it up and go over the screen with you to make sure all the pixels were working before they left.  That was my major problem with the TV.

Reviews.Title: High quality visual, but menu and speakers need some work.
Reviews.Author: Darren Widder
Reviews.Content: The LCD is very high quality, and produces a clear, colorful image.  The menu is not nearly as user-friendly as my Sony Bravia Cross-bar menu.  Sound is muffled since speakers are beneath the unit.  Speakers vibrate on certain tones at only about half power.  Those are some things Samsung should work on.

Reviews.Title: Best TV available in this price range
Reviews.Author: J. Reece "Neanderthal, Dark & Handsome"
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research on this TV before purchasing. I went to all the big box stores and hit all the review websites and what I kept hearing was that the only LCD TVs worth looking at are either Sony or Samsung. This one in particular kept getting rave reviews from all the reviewers and salespeople I talked with. Even a salesman who worked on commission said he would recommend this TV over some that were more expensive. The general consensus was that you have to get up close to two thousand dollars to get a TV better than this in this size.I've had this set for a few weeks now and have noticed several things. The picture is very clear, whatever source you select. I'm only running component video cables to it right now, but I'm anticipating that the picture will be even better once I get an HDMI cable on it. The menus are easy to use and easy to navigate, unlike many TVs I've owned. I've read reviews from a few folks who say that they don't like the little night light at the bottom of the frame, but if you dig into the menus a little, you can turn that on or off.My only big complaint about this TV, and it is a reasonable one, is the sound. First off, I'm not an audiophile. I can't tell the difference between extremely good speakers and only fairly good speakers without a lot of help from someone more knowledgeable. What I do know is that my little Philips CRT 25" that I got for a few hundred bucks from Wal-mart had sound that blows this TV out of the water. I don't push this TV too hard, and have never turned the volume up more than 1/3 of its capacity. Even so, when you get high sections in a song or something, the speakers make a really weird sound that I haven't heard from anything but an extremely cheap boom box. It's really frustrating to have a great picture and have the sound be so weak.I would also caution you that there is only one composite video input on this set, and it's on the side. If you have an older DVD player or a VCR or even an older video game system that you want to hook up to this, you'll either have to switch a lot of cables manually, or invest in one of those switch boxes. There are plenty of component video and HDMI inputs, but not much for lower quality feeds.So my recommendation to you is that if you're going to invest in this TV, invest in some speakers as well. They don't have to be amazing, but just about anything you buy will be better than what this thing comes with. That said, this TV is easily the best picture quality you can get in this size and price range, especially with the prices offered by Amazon (the same set was going for fifteen hundred dollars at the big box stores, and thirteen fifty on sale).

Reviews.Title: Very Good TV
Reviews.Author: Book Lover "booklynx"
Reviews.Content: I have been wanting a SAMSUNG HDTV for some time now and finally I got one - the LN40A550.It has one of the clearest pictures I have ever seen on a TV. I am very happy with my choice.The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is the fact that I have not been able to get the HDMI cable to work with my cablebox and also it took a while for me to get the sizing of my picture right. If I had it in 16:9 ratio, the screen would cut off the edges of the picture and it took a great deal of fiddling to get that to where I am happy.As for the HDMI - I am still trying to get that right and will keep working on it. Not sure if it is the cablebox but it should be easier to plug these in and diagnose any problems...

Reviews.Title: Overall a good product
Reviews.Author: George E. Carl
Reviews.Content: Samsung LN40A550 40-Inch 1080p LCD HDTVGood picture quality, excellent remote.  Delivery and set-up were excellent.  Sound leaves a bit to be desired, but can be corrected with an inexpensive home theater system.  A good purchase.

Reviews.Title: great picture, but.....the sound
Reviews.Author: R. A. ELLIOTT "r.e."
Reviews.Content: after months of research,i went with the samsung 40" 40a550. Went thru Amazon as i always do,and it went flawless.Ceva logistics called and delivered 2 days sooner and even took my old bulky magnavox  right out the door. Set up was a breeze. Since comcast had no hdmi box in stock ,i went with component hook up and picture is fantastic. I also have a 32 " sharp from 2006 ,but the sharp sound blows the samsung away.  Samsungs sound is very tinny,and you really cant exceed the volumn level,as it will cause distortion. Now,that said,after a few minutes you really forget about the sound issues ,unless your listening to a concert,etc. Price wise;you cant beat amazon. Pc richards,c.city , both were 250-300$ more. All in all ,im happy....just wish samsung put some thought into there sound.

Reviews.Title: Samsung delivers!
Reviews.Author: smos
Reviews.Content: This unit performs.  Easy hookup and a great picture. Amazon delivered on time, what can I say I'm very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Just buy it already...
Reviews.Author: A. Ontiveros
Reviews.Content: I had this TV on my wish list for at least a month, not sure if it was the TV for me. It is an awesome TV. Hi-def programing is incredible on this TV. If you've been waiting, just buy it. It's well worth it. I took advantage of Amazon's 30 day price guarentee as well. The only thing is the free shipping took almost 2 weeks to arrive. Not a big deal considering it was free.

Reviews.Title: Excellent HDTV
Reviews.Author: Victor Revenko
Reviews.Content: I just got this first HDTV after considerable research. Amazon had the best price. I was reluctant about buying via Amazon but the experience was great. The TV arrived in a few days and they set it up, checked it for apperarance and performance. A few days later the price dropped and Amazon quickly refunded the price difference.The setings were perfect and needed no adjustment. The HDTV works great with HD, digital, standard cable, DVD's and even VCR tapes.The design is nice with  a turnable pedastel.The July Fourth fireworks were awesome. Blacks are superb, color is vibrant ,whites are clear. The TV works well in bright or dark seeings.Sound is  excellent.The TV is set up about 100 feet from the digital cable box . I use coaxial cable with repeater and the results are great.A great HDTV for a great price

Reviews.Title: Best Picture Imaginable
Reviews.Author: E. FIELDS
Reviews.Content: Simply the Best picture, You will be THRILLED! At this price don't even bother comparing. Out Freaking Standing.Samsung LN40A550 40-Inch 1080p LCD HDTV

Reviews.Title: buy it!
Reviews.Author: A. Fahimy
Reviews.Content: this t.v. really stands up to all the hype...i have been looking into buying a flat panel for months and this one caught my eye at best buy..i just recieved the t.v a couple days ago and am completely blown away from the clarity of the picture..im not even using a cable box yet and standard television channels look amazing..the HD ones are beyong imagination...if your looking for a breath taking t.v. this is the one! minor irritations with the speakers due to a hallow sound but the can be overcome with a sound system. the picture quality more than makes up for this minor flaw

Reviews.Title: A fine HDTV with one flaw
Reviews.Author: Richard T. Miya "Mac user"
Reviews.Content: This is an LCD HDTV with an excellent picture and easy to follow instructions describing its many features. I had no difficulty making all the necessary connections including a Blu-Ray disc player. I also connected the TV audio system to my own receiver/amplifier system. My only caveat is directed to those who have MAC computers. I discovered in speaking with a Samsung customer service representative that Samsung HDTVs do not interface with the the Apple operating system. This is important if you intend to down load movies from Netflix.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 40" 1080P LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Tony W. Pintarelli
Reviews.Content: TV has a beautiful clear picture. The productdeliverey time frame and sevice was excellent! Amazon offered a sumstantial price savings.

Reviews.Title: All I can say is WOW!!!
Reviews.Author: C. Parker "C-rod"
Reviews.Content: Like a lot of people I did extensive research over the past month and a half trying to fine the perfect TV for the money I'm willing to spend.  I went from Toshiba to Sony to Samsung.  I visited every electronics store a could think of to view the TV's and found that Samsung's TVs where the best in the market.  This TV is awesome and I love it.  It took me about 35min to set it up because I was selecting the wrong input for my cable box.  O.K. lets go over the pros and cons.Pros: Great picture, decent sound (They don't build these TVs for great sound, the OEM figures that most people will get surround sound) Tons of options for picture and sound adjustment, very slick and stylish look, 3 HDMI inputs, the buttons on the remote control have a back light so you can see them at night,  menu is very user friendly and easy to navigate, has a USB port for pictures and firmware update, PS3 & my Xbox look amazing!!!!!Cons: The only con I have is really not with the TV but with Time Warner.  Time Warner's standard cable signal is weak and most of their channels are broadcast in analog.  Everyone is telling me that Direct TV is all digital and they are better for HDTVs.  I'm really thinking about switching.Oh I forgot that I plugged in an old rabbit ear antenna that my girlfriend found in the closet and I was able to pick up about 13 HD channels over the air!!!!  What's really funny is the free HD channels over the air look better that Time Warner's HD channels.  I guess that's because TW compresses the HD signal.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV; Great price!
Reviews.Author: A. Lu
Reviews.Content: Ordered this TV from amazon on 4/30 and came to my apartment on 5/5...not a bad turn-around time.  The TV was actually ready for delivery on 5/2 but I was stuck at work.Easy set-up, using HDMI to Time Warner cable.I'm a sports fanatic and there's absolutely nothing better than HD sports on this set.  The colors are so detailed, bright...flawless picture.  Baseball looks great but I must admit, Basketball in HD is breath-taking.Comes with 3 HDMI ports so I will eventually buy a PS3 for the blu-ray experience.The casing itself is glossy black and comes with a neat blue light at the bottom of the Samsung.Also priced $400-500 cheaper than any big retail store, this is a deal.  My only gripe was the delivery service Amazon used.  The company is called CEVO and I scheduled a delivery appointment for 9am-1apm.  Driver didn't come until 4:30pm and never called ahead of time to tell me he was going to be late.  The manager was very apologetic and seemed to push the driver to get to my place ASAP.For a 1080p set, you won't find a better quality for the price.  Looks like i'll be staying in a lot now.

Reviews.Title: It's Not Worth the Savings; Get the Sony
Reviews.Author: Gia
Reviews.Content: This TV was great for one year. Last week, one month after the warranty ran out, it started to turn itself off for a few seconds, randomly,  in the middle of a TV show or while playing a DVD. The screen goes black, but the audio stays on through our soundbar (which we had to purchase because the sound from the TV itself is practically unintelligible.) Samsung, apparently, is known for its terrible customer service and was true to its reputation, having no interest in a TV which is out of warranty. After doing some research online, we found hundreds (maybe thousands, literally) of complaints about this (and other) Samsung models, all of which have this exact problem that kicks in after a year or so. The consensus seems to be that the capacitors Samsung uses are known to go bad, but Samsung does not admit a problem. Our blackouts have been going on for a week or so, but from everything I've read, they will become longer and more frequent, until finally the TV won't go on at all. Some people have fixed their TVs with capacitors bought for a few dollars from Radio Shack, but this requires opening up the back and having soldering skills, not something I'm about to attempt. There's even a YouTube video on how to do it. Of further interest: there is a law firm that is currently investigating filing a class action lawsuit against Samsung, based on consumer complaints, and one can sign up on line. All this information is available by Googling "Samsung blackout problems". I certainly wish I'd known this before spending close to $1000 on this TV in December 2008, and I based my purchase on the hundreds of great reviews I found on Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great display but frustrating experience
Reviews.Author: P. Pauer "doctorp"
Reviews.Content: I had done a lot of searching and for this price range this is the best looking display I have found. Some other displays that I looked at handle motion and de-interlacing better than the Samsung, but to me the difference was not enough to justify the higher prices. The sound however is really horrible. Like others, I saw this in other reviews and thought how bad can it be? It's really bad. You don't have to be an audiophile to notice the lack of bass and hollow feeling coming from the speakers.Dealing with CEVA for delivery had to be the most difficult part of my purchase. They never contacted me to arrange for delivery and I came home one day to find a notice on my door that they had attempted delivery and to call them. They would not deliver on the weekends and I had to arrange for a friend to meet them because I could not get home from work within their delivery hours. After enjoying my new TV for three days the thing just died. The status lights came on but no picture. After about 10 minutes of troubleshooting I called Samsung support. They seemed to know right away what the problem was and that it would require a service call. I had to call another company to arrange for service but the only appointment I could make was weeks away. At this point I had had enough and called amazon and told them I was returning it. On Sunday morning I decided I was not going to be denied another Sunday of football in HD so I drove to Best Buy, got them to match Circuit City's price which was about $130 more than amazon, put it in my car, drove home and set it up. The entire process took less than an hour. I then had to call CEVA and arrange for pick up of the dead TV; the earliest they could come was two weeks later on a Saturday and they could only tell me some time between 10am and 5pm. The Friday before they called to say they could not come on the weekend. I now have to take a day off from work to stay home and wait for them to come pick this up.I have purchased Samsung TVs and monitors before and have always had good luck with them so I was surprised by the dud that I got. But I did end up purchasing the same model and I am very happy with it. I would never again order something from amazon that requires delivery from CEVA. If you don't have a job and can stay home all day to wait for delivery you can save some money, but for me the ability to deal with a brick and mortar store in the evenings or weekends is worth the extra money that I paid.

Reviews.Title: Great TV - easy delivery
Reviews.Author: S. Weinert "sweinert"
Reviews.Content: What a great tv. It has all the specs you'd want and as of my purchase date, Amazon offered the best deal on the net when considering base price, free white glove delivery, and no tax. The delivery was surprisingly smooth. Shipping firm called to schedule an appt. called when they were 20 minutes out, and arrived exactly as promised.A very neat feature is the embedded QAM tuner. I was able to plug the coax directly into my tv, no boxes or antennas, and get everything I wanted. The TV takes the role of cable box and displays program/channel info. I suppose this depends on your provider though.Only slight negative is the wiselink interface - its not very friendly if your intent is to connect your IPOD for photos/music/slideshows.

Reviews.Title: Was a great TV for 8 weeks, then Power supply failed
Reviews.Author: Adrian Michaud
Reviews.Content: This was a great TV for the initial 8 weeks; however, the power supply in mine just failed. I bought this TV to replace a 2005 32" Samsung model that also failed. I'm beginning to see a pattern here. I bought a 61" Samsung DLP LED HDTV last year and it also only lasted a few months before failing and needing repair. What a pain; I don't know why I keep buying Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Speakers are awful, lost the picture on an angle
Reviews.Author: JP "jpdavis79"
Reviews.Content: We are one of the families who bought this TV from Amazon and returned it. The purchase was made after we performed extensive research using Consumer Reports, online consumer blogs, and professional review sites. All the sites  gave the sound on this TV an above average rating. We could not disagree more. The speakers on this TV are the worst we ever had...think of the am transistor radios from your childhood. We resorted to purchasing external speakers designed for computers. We also found the picture to be great as long as we were dead center. If we got off center either to the side or at an angle, it became hazy and washed out. After trying for several weeks to make the TV work for us, we returned it. We now own two Panasonic HD plasama TVs. We also gave an LCD Sony to my in-laws. The Panasonic and Sony TVs have superior pictures both dead center and at angles. The sound quality is enhances watching TV.

Reviews.Title: Middle of the road review
Reviews.Author: TheHunn
Reviews.Content: Let me start this review by saying that with present technology the world is far from being prepared to administer High definition TV.  With this in mind it makes it very difficult to give an accurate Review of this Samsung HD LCD TV.  I have cable service with the digital option that provides the HD channels. I also have a DVD player that is an older model and does not support the progressive scan technology.When viewing a HD program that is broadcast in 1080p the picture is acceptable and superior to my old analog Sony TV.  I say that with some reservations because the Sony was a really exceptional TV that provided 16 years of service.  Hopefully this new set will last as long.One of the things that I like about the flat screen TV is the weight.  A 40 inch LCD is around 50 lbs. This opens up many options for placement of the TV almost anywhere in a room.  Hang it on a wall or set it on a table or cabinet.The picture quality when viewing an HD program is very good, but that is one of the problems.  Not all broadcasts on the HD channels are high def and the ones that are...well they come in many different formats.  Some are 16X9, some are 720p,  some are 1080p and the rest are some form of 4X3.  I bought a 40 in TV to watch 40 inches of TV.  This is not always the case.  Although this is not the fault of Samsung it is frustrating. To compound this frustration Samsung has included picture size options to compensate for the different formats. This is fine if you don't mind things being out of proportion.  One note about the options for these new flat screen TV's.  They do provide a lot of options and one can adjust his set to his or her own specifications.  I have been an Electronics Technician for over 40 years and have been involved with maintaining CCTV systems for the most of those 40 years.  The point I'm trying to make is that most of this technology is not new to me, but I still have trouble setting up this new TV with all the options available.  I wonder how many individuals actually have their TV setup properly or even know the difference whether or not it is set up right. To make my point my wife just asked me how to adjust the picture so you can see the writing on the bottom of the screen.  This isn't the first time I've showed her how to make this adjustment.Audio.  Well I'm not particularly impressed with the sound.  If you go to some of the major retailers you will notice that they have all the volumes turned down and usually have an expensive sound system playing.  If you think about it, the flat screen TV's are only a few inches in depth with a small space at the bottom or on the sides.  This doesn't leave much room for quality speakers.  So think about investing in a quality AV sound system, 5.1 or better.Sports and fast action is another area where LCD TV lacking.  They don't respond fast enough to give a picture that isn't pixilated or blurred. Even with a 5ms refresh rate the performance is poor at best when viewing fast action.  I knew about this problem before my purchase but I thought that with 5ms refresh rate it would be minimal I was wrong.So where does this leave me in reviewing this Samsung TV.  I'm going to give it 3 stars. I'm basing this on poor sound quality,  difficulty in setting up the options on the TV and the poor fast action response.  All flat screen TV's have these same inequities.  Samsung is still the best as compared to the others.

Reviews.Title: Overall good stuff
Reviews.Author: F. Flores
Reviews.Content: The tv is is at great price, but when it arrived, the tv was completely broken.  The screen was busted out, the base was shattered, it looked like they stood an elephant on the box before delivering it.  Obviously, it was aggravating, but the phone call to replace it took about 5 minutes and was painless.  The only problem was they don't have expedited shipping on tv's so I had to wait another week. Then replacement arrived on time and seems to work great.  The tv is lovely, just wish it would've arrived like that the first time.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN40A550
Reviews.Author: Tweetie
Reviews.Content: My first bigger ticket item through Amazon and have to say that I was more than happy with both pricing and delivery. The Sammy was a bargain compared to last year's non-120Hz models. Crisp even on STD broadcast. Draw back as in most reviews is the sound, as speakers located on botton of Tele, but to me still merits the 5 star award overall. Register with Sammy USA and you get an automatic 3 months' extension warranty on top of your standard 12.

Reviews.Title: What an AMAZING picture!
Reviews.Author: Jerry W.
Reviews.Content: I've had the Samsung LN40A550 for 2 weeks now and absolutely love this TV.Delivery was hassle free and quicker than Amazon predicted.I'm using an HDMI connection between my Comcast cable box/DVR and the TV and the picture quality is spectacular! The sound quality is perfectly acceptable as well. Although I have the TV connected to a home theater sound system, I only run that when watching a movie or sporting event. I see no need to have it on for regular TV programming, since the sound from this TV is very good.I agree with the accolades others have given to the Samsung LN40A550; it is truly exceptional. Thanks Amazon for an great deal on an excellent HDTV!

Reviews.Title: AFTER 3 YRS
Reviews.Author: Isy@
Reviews.Content: HELLO ALL,  I'VE HAD THIS TV FOR THREE YRS NOW. I RECENTLY HAVE A PROBLEM WITH IT TURNING ON. IT WOULD TAKE TWO MINUTES APPROXIMATELY AND GETTING LONGER EVERY DAY. HAVE HAD NO PROBLEMS WITH PICTURE AND EVERYTHING ELSE. I AM A SAMSUNG FAN. I HAVE 2 SAMSUNG TVS' AND 2 SAMSUNG BLURAY PLAYERS. I HAVE RESEARCHED THIS PROBLEM AND FOUND MOST OF MY ANSWERS FROM YOUTUBE. SO I CONTACTED CHAT SUPPORT AND THEY ADMITTED TO HAVING THIS PROBLEM WITH THIS TV AND WILL HAVE IT REPAIRED. I STILL HAVE TO CALL CUSTOMER SERVICE TO SCHEDULE SERVICE. HAVE YOUR MODEL AND SERIAL NUMBER ON HAND READY. I THINK SAMSUNG SHOULD HAVE A RECALL ON THIS MODEL.OTHERWISE WITH THEIR BACK UP ON THIS PRODUCT I WOULD STILL BUY THIS TV AGAIN. WILL KEEP YOU POSTED ON THE REPAIR SERVICE.UPDATE 6/911. THE SAMSUNG SERVICE TECHNICIAN CAME TO OUR HOUSE TODAY TO FIX THIS TV. TOOK HIM 15 MINUTES TO DO EVERYTHING. NOW MY TV IS IN WORKING ORDER AGAIN.  SO IF YOU HAVE THE SAME PROBLEM PLS CALL 1 800 SAMSUNG. THEY ARE THERE 24-7 TO HELP OUT.Update October 23, 2012. This TV is doing the same problem it had last June 9, 2011. Did an online chat at [...] and got a free ticket for another capacitor change. The technician came to change another capacitor. Worked for the rest of the day but the next day the same problem existed. It's as if no one came to "fix" it at all. Got another sevice ticket number via chat and  they said someone will contact me. I am also experiencing these vertical lines and a mishmash of colors while tv is recycling to turn itself on. It's only been four years and a few months. I had expected for this TV to last longer than that. I have not yet even exhausted the hours allowed for it's lifetime. Soo disappointed . I will think 50 times before buying another Samsung TV.UPDATE: NOV 26/12  Not starting again; This time with additional  vertical lines and a mish mash of colors prior to actually starting (after 5-10 minutes of recycling start-up). Called Samsung. They sent a technician again who changed the capacitors again. TV continues to do the same thing. Called Samsung and the tech. He says the problem is no longer the capacitor, but the main board. I was not throwing this TV out. It cost a lot when I bought it. I thought about giving it a chance. I only have to pay for the main board and labor was free. Tech came to the house to change it. It cost me $195 for a new main board. IT NOW WORKS LIKE A CHARM...LIKE NEW. THAT WAS MONTH AGO AND STILL THE TV IS WORKING GREAT. I AM KEEPING MY FINGERS CROSSED.

Reviews.Title: Broken TV took 3 weeks to fix
Reviews.Author: Tony Ho
Reviews.Content: Samsung sent me a tv that worked for the first 3 days and then broke all on its own.  When I asked for the repair, it took 3 weeks before they could repair it because they have to try different parts and then order the next part and reschedule after each time they try.  All in all it's fixed now, but when I called customer service to let them know how ridiculous it was the lady was rude and trying to brush me off.  I most likely will not be purchasing a samsung tv next time.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Cesaw
Reviews.Content: Went specifically for a Samsung.  I loved my 720p, so as far as I was concerned, nothing could compare. The 720p pic was AWESOME! That model was discontinued. This pic can't compare to the 720p.  Even w/ HD channels on cable, and digital cable box,and HDMI cables,the pic looks grainy, especially in dark scenes. On non HD channels, it's like watching an old "tube" TV. On my 720p, the pic's were always sharp and crisp, and I didn't need to watch a HD station. To be blunt, the sound sucks. I have it on a stand and not wall mounted, so that may have something to do w/ the way the sound bounces off of something. I just want to watch TV, so I'm not interested in setting up surround sound, or extra speakers to correct it. I researched several Samsung's for a couple of monthes, and after all the rave reviews just waited for the right price on this specific model.  Boy am I disappointed. I'd say you can't get a worse picture for an HDTV if you went for a cheaper, bargain brand. In this case, I didn't get what I paid for. I've been researching and watching prices for a 50" Plasma and it was down to Samsung and Panasonic. As far as I'm concerned, Samsung is out of the running for my next TV purchase.

Reviews.Title: Backlighting Issues
Reviews.Author: P. Young "Mac User"
Reviews.Content: We had two shipped to use (one was a replacement) and both had backlighting issues. The corners would be overly bright (as in white). Pressure issue? Not sure. Normally during darker shots it was unavoidable to notice. I would recommend getting one series newer. Hopefully they resolved the issue.

Reviews.Title: Not happy with Samsung
Reviews.Author: Ivanthinkin "Ivan T."
Reviews.Content: I bought a samsung ln40a550, but wasn't very happy with it. I really don't like that most manufacturers have gone to the glossy frames. It's just stupid. Any ambient light source is going be be reflected and distract from the picture you're trying to see. The samsungs (and most others) have a wide bezel (frame) that creates more of a problem than with matte finish, or slimmer bezels.The bigger issue with the ln40a550 was the fact that they make the middle range models with lcd displays supplied by multiple manufacturers, and of varying quality. You can't tell which one you get until you open the box. Go to google and search 'samsung bait and switch'. It's interesting, there used to be an amazon discussion called 'Amazon.com: Customer Discussions: Samsung "S" panel bait and switch?' that had a lot of good info about this issue, but Amazon removed it. (I can't say I care for Amazon censoring these discussions as long as they're not obscene or something). I guess it was causing too many people to return their samsungs. Bottom line on the panels.S = made by samsung at samsung factoryA = made by auo for samsung -outsourcedC = Made by chi-me for samsung - outsourcedThe quality appears to go from best = S to worst = C.Anyway, mine was a 'C' panel, so I returned the samsung, did some more research, and bought a sony.

Reviews.Title: Poor sound quality
Reviews.Author: Watchful Consumer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV after seeing it get such an excellent review by Consumer Reports.  The picture is great, but boy was I disappointed with the sound on this TV.  The speakers face down towards the ground, there are no speakers facing out forward toward you.  It sounded like I was in a tunnel while I listened to this TV.  Also, it wasn't very clear at low volumes, which is important to me.  I ended up going with a Sony in it's place and the sound is so much better.

Reviews.Title: Super value
Reviews.Author: Raybor
Reviews.Content: A very recent issue of Consumer Reports cited the Samsung LN40A550 as the best HDTV in it's size range, & went on to name it the best value in any size range. I went on-line & discovered this model was being offered by Amazon at a price significantly lower than the "value" price listed by Consumer Reports.......and, free shipping. Less than a week after ordering it from Amazon the set was delivered, and the delivery men offered free unpacking & removal of the large carton.  This being my first HDTV, I did experience some difficulty hooking it up....in part, I'm sure because I tried to go ahead and do it without thoroughly reading the instructions, & in part I was connecting to a new HD receiver the cable company provided.  I called Samsung tech. service, & in minutes they got me squared away, & I was watching as good,as sharp, as clear a TV picture as I've ever seen.  Having lived through the "morphs" of TV from a tiny 9" round black & white picture, to color, to transisters replacing troublesome vacuum tubes, & now to digital LCD display screens in amazing HD. Somehow technology will account for future advances, but as I enjoy HD programing on my new Samsung, I'm hard pressed to imagine the challenge of improving on this.

Reviews.Title: Only time will tell
Reviews.Author: Football watcher "Football watcher"
Reviews.Content: This is my second TV. The TV was great but it lasted six days before it stopped working. Samsung wanted to fix it but after having it for less than a week I wanted a new TV. Amazon was great. Less than a week later I had a brand new TV. I'm crossing my fingers that the first one was just a lemon.

Reviews.Title: Once you go HD you'll never go back...
Reviews.Author: Chuck "Chuck"
Reviews.Content: I had some expectations when i ordered this television, the 30,000 to 1 contrast ratio being highest on the list. Happy to say it has met all expectations I had. Out of the box settings were spot on and I haven't played with any. I did go to BB and look at televisions, couldn't find this model, but on thing stood out was that salesmen who were not on commission at 2 separate locations steered me to Samsung for the quality of picture. I took that to heart and bought this one... buy on YOU WON"T BE DISAPPOINTEDChuck

Reviews.Title: samsung bliss
Reviews.Author: David A. May
Reviews.Content: Purchased my Samsung LN40A550, after deliberating and agonizing for a "lifetime" on what to get. can't tell you how many trips i made from southern Vt. to the likes of costco, sears, circuit city, and best buy, before i went on-line to Amazon.I had done my homework, and decided to go with the 1080p, but i just didn't want to pay the big bucks.Amazon's pricing was exceptional and the T.V. is even better. the white glove delivery went as promised; the delivery man set up the unit and checked that all was well before having me sign the release.right out of the box this lcd has worked flawlessly. that said, i'm only on my landlord's basic Dish cable thus far, as i can't decide whether to go with dish, direct, or comcast for my HD needs.the frustrating Dish service keeps losing its signal in any kind of bad weather (will that occur with comcast cable? verizon's Fios isn't available as yet. )i read all of the user reviews of this product before purchasing, and "knock wood", just have't had any of the few problems noted by some reviewers. the picture is sharp and clear, and the first DVD i played was mel gibson's "Apocolypto" on my Sony upcoverting player(HDMI). looked fantastic. Menu is relatively easy to use as well.of course i couldn't close without stating a minor "negative". when watching golf and they do a close-up of a rolling ball during a putt, i do get some "tracking" (if that's the right term) of the ball as it heads towards the hole. but that's it.so if you're perplexed as i was, be reassurred that purchasing this set from Amazon will be a good experience, and you should love your Samsung purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great TV overall a great value
Reviews.Author: C. Zuniga
Reviews.Content: An amazing picture.  The the sound is excellent.  Some of the best I've heard from built in TV speakers.  The remote is very well layed out. Very easy to setup and configure.I bought my TV through amazon using their white glove service within week I had my TV in my living room.  The delivery people even took it out of the box and plugged it in to made sure it worked before leaving with the gigantic box it came in.  I bought it along with the Samsung upconversion DVD 1080P8 player.My only complaint is not with Samsung but with Time Warner Cable who only have a handful of HD channels.  Definately switching to DirecTV now that I have a HDTV.

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: D. Powell
Reviews.Content: Got our tv last night.  I had it delivered to my office but the delivery guy helped me set it up at my workstation and made sure everything worked.  What a beautiful set.  The tv itself is elegant and simply detailed.  The picture is phenomenal and the setup was a sinch.  For the price you cannot get a better deal.  Even regular (non-HD) channels looked great through the hdmi connection.

Reviews.Title: Interesting Product
Reviews.Author: Tucson Bob
Reviews.Content: Good product.  Worth the price.  If you think this might be what you're looking for today, give it a try.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN40A550 is an excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Kathy M. Roepke
Reviews.Content: Purchased this Samsung LN40A550 for my elderly parents.  They are thrilled with this TV - the picture quality and sound are very good and serve the purpose for changing from the old style tube 32" TV over the the LCD 40" screen.  Although this product has been replaced by newer models with more features - my parents Samsung LN40A550 is going strong.  It came with a good remote too - able to control the TV and DVD player with ease.  Great product.

Reviews.Title: Died Saturday
Reviews.Author: Chris Greenough
Reviews.Content: Great day for my TV to go black. Dad visiting from Naples and right in the middle of NCAA tournament and dinner.  It is not coming back to life. (read many of the posts about those who had same issue) Did  get my $$$'s worth? You tell me? Should a TV die after just 4 years? Granted I play a lot of MArio KArt but not that much. I find it ironic that it died the day I plugged my Dad's Samsung cell phone into the USB side to charge while I ran out to run an errand. Upon return: black screen (no can;t even see menu) So my review: Garbage, just like all technology today, made to break.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LCD TV's are Throw-aways
Reviews.Author: KEA
Reviews.Content: Stunning picture. Substandard components. Horrendous customer service.I purchased this television November 22, 2008. It was delivered and put into service about a week later.The picture is stunning! I enjoyed the TV problem-free for approximately 2-2 ½ years. There were problems turning on, pixilation, and sometimes a problem displaying an image. One day the problems just corrected themselves. Then four months ago, the TV developed other problems. Online research indicated that there was a capacitor problem and that Samsung would repair the problem as part of a class action suit.  The bulging capacitor problem as fixed but the other problems continued. The high- pitch screeching sound when the TV comes on, the cycling off and on for ten minutes with and without various humming and screeching sounds. The series of screens with fine vertical lines running from top to bottom, some in green, some in white, and others in multiple colors. Two different TV repair technicians said the problem was the main digital board. They advised me to buy a new television since  the cost to repair the Samsung TV would not be worth it; I could purchase a new television for $500-600.The problems with this television are shared by many other purchasers, including some who posted reviews here. Even on the Samsung support site the problems with this particular model are outlined by numerous owners. Google Samsung LCD television problems and you will read hundreds of accounts of problems. Samsung knows of these problems but refuse to fix them, stating that the television is no longer under warranty.A $1000 television should last more than 4 years. I will never ever purchase another Samsung product.Buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: off/on problem, samsung will not stand behind product
Reviews.Author: walt johnson
Reviews.Content: My TV will no longer come on when turned on, it goes on/off/on/off  with no picture. Samsung says being my model was made in 2009 they will not do anything about it as the problem has been fixed by then. Obviosly it wasn't. It is a capacitor problem that they have had for years and do have a class action case against them. I ended up buying a Toshiba 40"TV and put the Samsung in the garbage, as that is what it was. (our garbage pick up does dispose of them properly) My Samsung microwave latch broke earlier this week. Samsung made a good name for themselves and then switched to poor quality and does not stand behind thier product any longer. Avoid buying Samsung products.

Reviews.Title: only lasted less than 4 years
Reviews.Author: S. Peng "Chili Pepper"
Reviews.Content: We bought in July 2008 and it had problem to turn on initially and finally this year it won't turn on at all. Samsung's contract repair store has a bad reputation. They asked us to drop off the TV and 3 days later told us that it would cost us $419 to get it fixed. Yeah right! I could buy a brand new TV with that TV and probably would last longer than 3 years.This will be our last Samsung TV.

Reviews.Title: Power supply died!
Reviews.Author: Margaret Crupi
Reviews.Content: Brought this tv in 2008 because of all the great reviews! Tv was great then would not go on. Samsung said that it was out of warranty but would fix it once free if it was capacitors. Then I was told to come to house was 98.00 dollars. So I drop off tv at the repair shop! Well cost me 289.25 for a bad power supply! The tv is working great again but I'm not going to pay 289.25 every couple of years as I can see this is a chronic problem with this Samsung tv! Will not buy another Samsung after this! Paid too much for a tv that stops working after a couple of years!  I have a Sony that is ten years old and still working! Think I'll stay with sony or maybe LG or sharp after this!

Reviews.Title: Don't expect to get PIP with this tv
Reviews.Author: smllchng
Reviews.Content: I have had this tv for about 2 years or so, with no real problem....good picture and sound, etc, but it does bother me that it said it offered a pitcure in picture function...but the PIP is only for analog tv reception....which is no longer available...so don't expect to get picture in picture (one of the big selling points for me, and I am really disappointed). Other than that, I have been happy with the TV.

Reviews.Title: Great Choice
Reviews.Author: penpal
Reviews.Content: I had this TV for over a year and so far have really enjoyed it.  It survived two moves without a scratch.  I especially like the size of the screen, ease of set up and operation.  I love the fact that I can plug in my thumb drive and show off my pictures and play music off of it.  I know that it is not the "newest" technology out there, considering how quickly everything is developed and improved, I would still recommend this TV and especially Samsung brand for a TV.

Reviews.Title: 40 inches of entertainment!
Reviews.Author: Jimm
Reviews.Content: Plenty of features, I use this TV as my main TV and as a secondary PC monitor for my PC. Easy to hook up and to switch from over-the-air signals, to cable to PC and it still has 4 video inputs available. It's a sleek looking unit.

Reviews.Title: Watch out for infrared (IR) interference with other devices
Reviews.Author: R. Fallin
Reviews.Content: Overall I have been pleased with this TV, until I bought a Roku media player.  After buying this player came to realize that whenever the screen is dark, this TV generates IR interference and makes the Roku remote unusable.  This means that if the TV is displaying the Roku's dark screen saver then you can't wake up the Roku device with the remote.  After researching this issue on the Internet I see that many people are having the same issue with different Samsung TV's interfering with Cable/Sat set top boxes and DVD players.  I called Samsung and they won't do anything about this issue because it is out of warranty and not enough people have complained about the issue for "this model" to warrant a recall.

Reviews.Title: Love it..
Reviews.Author: A. Oommen "AO"
Reviews.Content: Sturdy and quality item. Purchased it over a year and a half back. No issues so far. I had also purchased additional warranty for this, hopefully won't need to use it!!

Reviews.Title: The Ideal Television You're Looking For
Reviews.Author: William Tucker
Reviews.Content: I don't know much about televisions, but this one has been great. I've had it for about a year now, no issues. Amazing picture, I haven't seen better. Very thin, looks great in my living room. Nothing bad to say about it at all.

Reviews.Title: Great multi-use TV!!!
Reviews.Author: Edward Cantu II
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv to replace a smaller LCD tv that I'd had for about a year, and I had high expectations. At the time, I owned all 3 game consoles, and a great computer that I wanted to all be able to display on this TV.
