Reviews.Title: Very Nice TV, White Glove Service not so great.
Reviews.Author: Dan TV "Dan"
Reviews.Content: I am on week one of my TV and am very pleased. I upgraded from a 27" crt model and the difference just knocks you out. On recommendation of a friend I watched some Discovery Channel HD programming. All I can say is "WOW!"Everyone else has pretty much said what needs to be said, but I do have one comment. I saw a review where someone mentioned getting an $11 HDMI cable.Folks, if you are going to spend this kind of money on a TV, why be cheap with the cable? Go ahead and spend a little extra to get the 10g monster cable. You wouldn't buy a new porsche and put a honda civic transmission in. Would you?The only negative I have about this purchase is the white glove delivery service. The tracking info had my TV scheduled for June 11 delivery. I expected to get a call on June 10 to schedule a time. Instead, the TV showed up unannounced on the 10th. It was just lucky someone was home at the time. And then the guys just plopped the box down in the livinging room and left. No unpacking, no taking the garbage away.I of course called Amazon. The first person I talked to about it thanked me for telling them, but made no offer of a rebate. I didn't pursue the matter with her because I wanted to wait until I got the tv unpacked and set up, so I would know if there were any problems. My next call was made that night and I was told I'd have to call back during the day. That surprised me, I had never run into that with Amazon before.Finally I talked to a guy the next day who at first didn't seem to understand why I was dissatisfied. I told him that the white glove delivery is supposed to be part of the service. He told me I should keep the box for at least 30 days in case there was a problem. I tried to tell him that if the delivery service did their job correctly I wouldn't have the box anyway. That logic seemed to escape him.But he did pass the report on to someone else and a couple days later I got an email telling me I had a $30 credit.I'm not sure I feel totally recompensed for my trouble, but it was something.So the moral is. The TV is great, but don't count on the white glove people to do their job.

Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: M. E. Wild
Reviews.Content: Was a little skepticle about buying a tv without first seeing with my own eyes.But every Samsung product I've had has been good.So took the plunge.Now we're glad we did.Picture is excellent,especially HD programs.A little grainy on older films but still not bad.Sound is OK,better than our old CRT tv.Price was well within the budget.Would definitely recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Fast Delivery
Reviews.Author: B.A. Oaktree
Reviews.Content: TV arrived in 3 days.  Easy to hook up to sattelite; great picture, looks good in TV cabinet.  No complaints.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Fred Nielson
Reviews.Content: Dollar for dollar this was more than I expected and would recommend to everyone looking for LCD TV.

Reviews.Title: great purchase
Reviews.Author: James Vanpelt "tv nut"
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the tv as well as the quick shipping.i would purchase this product again.

Reviews.Title: WOW!!!
Reviews.Author: D. Velez
Reviews.Content: I've owned this set for a little over a month, I'm almost afraid to write the review because I haven't had the best luck with electronics and I don't want to jinx it, but it's honestly been one of the best purchases I've made.  Prior to purchasing, I did some research on the net, and Samsung consistantly came up as one the best HDTV manufacturers and this model particularly ranked high. Originally, I was looking at the 32" HDTV but the 40" went on sale a couple days later, it had all the right bells & whistles, and for the money I couldn't ask for better. The shipping was free and superfast (within days), the delivery men brought it up to the second floor, took it out of the box and set it down on the stand.  The set up was quick and easy. The picture is just amazingly beautiful. After reading other reviews, the sound quality was of some concern but it sounds as good if not better than other TVs I had checked out. Believe me I'm in no hurry to set up the Surround Sound system. I've gone to a few friend's homes and overall their higher end sets just don't compare.  You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: JOE BLOW "TV Man"
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent product, and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a television!

Reviews.Title: Buy Samsung...Buy the Best
Reviews.Author: Michael R. Darius
Reviews.Content: I have 3 Samsung Hi Def 1080P TV's in my home.  I wouldn't own a different brand. Absolutely no trouble with the tv's, the color, picture, and remotes are fine.  My latest is the 40 inch 1080p LN40a550. No disappointment as usual.  Great TV for the price and I know this TV will be trouble free as my other two Samsungs. When you compare tv's, look at the contrast ratio's.  You will see Samsung far surpasses all the others.  Buy this tv with confidence.  You will be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: Why Does This Happen To Me?
Reviews.Author: F. Greenrose
Reviews.Content: I ordered the tv on Jan. 3.  I tried to track the item, but something was amiss.  On Jan.19 I found out that paperwork and no product had been shipped, and I was supposed to be notified Jan.14!  I re-ordered the tv and waited until Jan 29 for it to arrive (white glove).  The delivery truck called when they were at the top of my drive, but because of the snow they told me to either reschedule delivery or pick it up myself (at the top of the drive) because they would not attempt to approach the house.  I backed up to the truck and they put the box of the 40 inch tv in the back.  I unpacked it and set it up myself.  Jan 3-Jan29...an ordeal!

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: K. Wanner
Reviews.Content: I love this TV! We've had it for just over a month and I don't know how we waiting this long. Thanks Uncle Sam!

Reviews.Title: Samsung TV
Reviews.Author: M. C. Levine
Reviews.Content: Very cumbersome to turn on and off.  Otherwise, this TV has a beautiful picture, is a great size, and is a pleasure to watch.

Reviews.Title: Great buy.
Reviews.Author: PublicGuest "Robbie Force"
Reviews.Content: At first when i saw the link for this TV i was thinking its got good specs in all but how can it be so cheap? I thought there was some sort of catch because i have seen other TVs that are 1080P and have a real low contrast ratio go for around the same price so i waited and eventually purchased it and let me tell you its a great buy. There are however several things i was unsatisfied with one was the amount of HDMI cables which can be used theres only 2 ports and the USB port dosent read video files it only reads mp3s and pictures.WARNING ANY TV MADE BEFORE 2008 DECEMBER BY SAMSUNG IS KNOWN TO HAVE A FLICKERING CLICKING POWER SUPPLY ISSUE YOU CAN CONTACT SAMSUNG AND THEY ARE REQUIRED BY THE COURT OF LAW TO FIX IT.

Reviews.Title: PIP feature
Reviews.Author: John E. Barr
Reviews.Content: I ordered the product hoping the PIP feature would be the same as what I'm used to but it is not. It's useless for the application I'd hoped for. I'm still trying to figure out if I can use it at all.

Reviews.Title: Very Slow Delivery
Reviews.Author: Long Idler "N"
Reviews.Content: The item took too long to be delivered (8 Days even though it was in stock)). Very good otherwise.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Rosa Dix
Reviews.Content: I love this TV.  Was a little afraid to buy a big ticket item online.  Everything went smoothly and I saved money!

Reviews.Title: Can't beat the price!
Reviews.Author: M. Lamonica
Reviews.Content: You can't beat this for the price.  I was pricing out older models at the box stores (only 15,000:1 contrast and 8 MS refresh rate) and even those were still more expensive.  The order went well and the delivery was faster than Amazon predicted.The picture on the TV is amazing, although you can notice shadows on fast movement if you are viewing the tv from the side.  Other than that, the tv is wonderful!!!!

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: Donald Fitzpatrick
Reviews.Content: Picture is great only had one minor problem and Amazon addressed that at once! Delivery took a couple days longer than I expected but overall I am very satisfied with the end results.

Reviews.Title: OVER RATED
Reviews.Author: Silver Bullet
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV based largely on the brand name and I have been disappointed. The picture is fine but the sound is terrible. You must figure on buying an amplifier and aux. speakers right off the bat. Then too, the remote only works if you aim it directly at the blue light and there is very little tolerance in the narrow angle it will accept. Forget about wall hanging this TV unless the person operating it plans to sit always directly in front of it and has good aim with the remote. I have an inexpensive 32" Fizio HDTV in the bedroom and it is a much better TV. I may try to trade the Samsung in for a Fizio. Think it over.

Reviews.Title: Impressive picture!  Bad power consumption rates! USB WISELINK needs movie clip .avi .mpg. .wmv abilitiy for good review.
Reviews.Author: Brett G. Michaelis "okbret"
Reviews.Content: Impressive picture!  Bad power consumption rates! USB WISELINK needs movie clip .avi .mpg. .wmv abilitiy for good review.I bought one of these Samsung HD LCD TV's.  I love the picture! I saw a news channel state that these new LCD tv's consume 2 to 3 times more electricity than regular tube or rear projection tv's. That is absolutely rediculous.The USB Wiselink is awesome except that it does not allow me to play .avi .mpg. .wmv video files.  I can only slideshow pictures and thats it.

Reviews.Title: Good production
Reviews.Author: Jun Zhou
Reviews.Content: The picture is excellent and easy to install. So far so good. You have to have HD program to the difference.

Reviews.Title: samsung is a rip off!
Reviews.Author: Molly K. Hershberger "Samsung victim"
Reviews.Content: Samsung products are a waste of my precious money.  LCD HD Tv is overly complicated to operate; my remote came broken; customer service from Samsung is non-existent; operating manual is practically useless.  The only thing selling it is it's thin body style - but the heat it throws off is overwhelming!!!!!  Wish I'd just stayed home from the store and saved my money.

Reviews.Title: TV simply didn't live up to the hype.
Reviews.Author: B. Hawley "PhillipSucks"
Reviews.Content: We got this TV as a replacement for our 42" plasma that failed. We were really excited to get an LCD that had great reviews, even though it was a couple of inches smaller. After all, we had read that Samsung is the best.While we did not have the HDMI issue that many write about, the sound quality on this TV was absolutely horrific. For a TV that many raved about the picture, the sound quality was far less than our 3 year old plasma that had just broken. I realize many people don't buy an LCD for the sound quality (and we do have external speakers), but you should be able to stomach the sound on your TV.The biggest, most glaring issue with this TV was the picture setting. You have four options total, which should be plenty. But I always like watching the full screen viewing, regardless of it being HD or regular TV. There is no way to stretch regular TV to be full screen unless you want to use the "zoom" mode, which cuts off a good portion of the top and bottom of the picture. It was dismayed to find this basic feature missing from this TV.After two days, this TV went back in the box and was returned, not because of a defect, but because the sound quality and picture options were not thought through. I am shocked at all of the great reviews on this TV. There are simply better options. We found a 46" Sony Bravia LCD (120 hz) for $50 more and are thrilled.

Reviews.Title: Picture-in-picture (PIP) is not fully supported
Reviews.Author: Dave "Digital Media Guru"
Reviews.Content: Picture-in-picture (PIP) is not fully supported.  I have confirmed this with Samsung support.  The most common scenario that I can think of is NOT supported - which is over-the-air (OTA) digital tv and another signal (digital or analog). There are no options for PIP with OTA digital tv as one of the sources.

Reviews.Title: poor sound--great picture
Reviews.Author: Alfred S. Walden
Reviews.Content: We are very happy with the picture but the sound quality is poor.  We had to purchase a separate sound system

Reviews.Title: Returned TV Because of Faulty Seam at Bottom of Set
Reviews.Author: Joseph A.
Reviews.Content: I don't know if this problem is related to Samsungs in general or just this particular model, but after I turned the TV on, I noticed a small glowing light just below the screen. At first, I thought it was part of some "cool design feature", but after taking a closer look, I realized that this was caused by an improperly sealed trim at the bottom edge of the set that was allowing light to escape through. Naturally I was disappointed because this was my first HDTV. I ended up returning the TV for a refund because I didn't want to take a chance on an exchange having the same problem. On a positive note, because I purchased the TV from Amazon and not one of their vendors, I was able to get a full refund including shipping. Otherwise, I might not have received a full and prompt credit on my card.

Reviews.Title: LCD TVs have BAD Color!
Reviews.Author: L. Arthur
Reviews.Content: Here is the summary:1.  Amazon delivery service was awesome!2.  Samsung makes probably some of the best LCD HDTVs you can buy, but...3.  If you are coming from a CRT EDTV or HDTV, you will be dissappointed.  LCD TVs don't have near the color accuracy of CRT (the best), or even plasma TV (very good).  No matter how much time you spend calibrating the color with signals, and test disks, and test images from computer, etc, etc, you will at best get a picture that has about 30-50% correct color and the rest will be a slightly "off" hue which will forever distract your mind in trying to figure out, but it won't quite be able to.I compared by watching the same content on this TV after I calibrated it as well as possible (Samsung has some very good controls for calibrating the TV unlike other brands), with a 2 year old Panasonic Plasma (720p) and the plasma blew the color accuracy doors off this LCD.  Nothing I could do to make the LCD even close.The plasma has a true "3-D" look to the image, they look life like.  The LCD images just look flat, and ink blotchy.  Despite all my calibration, once in a while an image will come on the LCD which shows some signs of color banding.... just terrible.Unfortunately no one makes a plasma TV smaller than 42" so I had to choose this LCD.

Reviews.Title: Pure Cap
Reviews.Author: L. Myers "Johannkepler"
Reviews.Content: If you like the sound gong off, or the picture going off, or thr whole thing dying completely, then this is the boat anchor for you.  Complete trash, and they won't back it up.  Stay away from Samsung rip-off artists

Reviews.Title: Shipping nightmare
Reviews.Author: kjw66
Reviews.Content: No matter what others say, I truly think shipment is a vital component of an online purchase.I ordered my TV on 12/2.  Amazon's so-called "white glove delivery service" states that I would be contacted within 5 days to arrange delivery.  It's been 13 days with no phone call from them, although I've called them 3 times with no success on getting a delivery date.CEVA was their shipper of choice--I live in Illinois and the TV shipped from Indiana. I just deciphered today that my TV shipped from Indianapolis to Chicago via ARGENTINA (yes, South America), so who knows what kind of condition it'll be in.  Due to the 12,000 mile journey and the 6 days the TV spent in Argentina, I've told Amazon to cancel the order due to the possibility of damage to internal components of the TV.  No response from them yet.I won't ever be ordering anything from Amazon again unless it can shipped via UPS or USPS.Makes me wonder if the all bad reviews about technical problems with the TV resulted from damage during shipping.  Maybe?

Reviews.Title: Dissatified with shipping rules for Electronics
Reviews.Author: Rosemary Seals "rosemary seals"
Reviews.Content: About a month ago I order a DVD player form this company .  It was delivered to my home address since they can not deliver to P.O. Box's .  When the DVD player arrived I was not at home the UPS people left me a note to pick it up within 5 days or return back to sender.  I called UPS(United Postal Service) the same day I received the notice and they said that my DVD player was still  on the truck coming back that same day.  I said ,fine will be in to pick up the very next day.  I went in the very next day the UPS people advised me that this company does not have a will call policy meaning do not hold any items return to sender.  I immediately called the Electronics company, I was advised by their customer service dept. that they have this policy for security reason due to electronics being shipped out.  To make a long story short it took me three weeks and the help of Amazon gurantee return policy(they intervined and contacted the company after I did) to get the refund with the shipping charged included.  I will continue to use Amazon they are so professional and courteous but this compay is for the birds and I would never use them again and they need to be red flagged.

Reviews.Title: Poor sound quality - had to return
Reviews.Author: Grammarian A.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I immediately noticed the tinny sound -- i.e., lacking depth. It gets worse as you increase the volume but is noticeable at any normal volume level. I expect decent sound out of the built-in speakers and do not plan to purchase a home theater system. This bugged me so much that I decided to return it and purchase a Sony V-Series TV instead (awaiting delivery).

Reviews.Title: Horrible customer support.
Reviews.Author: Alexis Alexandrou
Reviews.Content: Samsung customer support is horrible, were not able to help and did not make me feel as a valuable customer. I had to call the cable company to get help.

Reviews.Title: Big dissappointment
Reviews.Author: M. Syed
Reviews.Content: I had purchased this tv from 6th Avenue with high hopes and because I believed Samsung is a good brand. However when I recieved it today I was gutted as the picture would not display full screen. I went into the "menu --> Picture options --> size" and set it to 16:9 and yet the picture wouldnt display on the fullscreen. Only when I switched the size to wide display did it display full screen. I had a lengthy discussion with a customer service representative of samsung and somebody is going to come to my house on the 2nd of December to try and fix this issue. Unfortunately 6th Avenue doies not have a return policy for tv's 37" and above. I feel like I am stuck with a defective tv :( . Don't commit the same mistake.I will update my review with how the repair experience goes...

Reviews.Title: Be careful
Reviews.Author: hadagain
Reviews.Content: The TV gives a good picture, but really lousy, muted sound. Mess with the equalizer all you want, but muffled is the word. The lowest price guarantee is a game of wills. The price has dropped twice since I bought it, but the offshore customer rep was a master of the runaround. No refund. His accent was even more muted than the TV. I am still fighting for my $105. Any odds on my getting it? If you are happy, consider yourself lucky. Some of us regret the buy.

Reviews.Title: Nice HDTV to match a playstation 3
Reviews.Author: ALQ
Reviews.Content: I am 2 days into using with a playstation 3, connected via a simple HDMI cable. The image quality is really great and works very well with even the fastest-paced action games. Sound is decent, not quite as clear as stand-alone PC 2.1 speakers but good enough for a 15x15 room.The next test is going to be the connection of a DVI-D source (a macbook) via the 2nd HDMI port. If it works, it's going to be a swell secondary display. For some reason, VGA did not work out of the box.

Reviews.Title: "HELP
Reviews.Author: Dennis B. Aubin
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the Samsung 40" LN40A550 To say the least I'm not impressed. The colors no matter how I set up aren't very vibrant. The picture quality is poor, even on high def. channels. I'm hooked into the local cable system through their cable box using the coaxial cable from the box to the set. Is there any advantage to using a HDMI cable? Am I doing something wrong? Is there a possibility the cable hd converter box is malfunctioning??Any help will be deeply appreciated. I'm certain I will return this set if I cannot work this out.

Reviews.Title: fair
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: The series 5 Samsung TV we purchased is ok. The sound is good. The controls are easy enough to use. The picture quality is just OK. I had expected the picture to be clearer than it is. We have dish network and even the HD. channels are not very clear.

Reviews.Title: Lame LCD's
Reviews.Author: Abdulrahman
Reviews.Content: I bought my Samsung 40 inch LCD 14 months ago, with warranty policy of only 12 months. Just 6 weeks after the warranty had expired and all of a sudden, my LCD started showing a RED VERTICAL line accross the screen. After contacting the customer service and inspecting my problem they told me that the PANEL needs to be changed which would cost me nearly the price of a brand new LCD. I don't understand how poor in quality these LCD's are when they suddenly break on their own. What makes it even worse is that the local dealer wouldn't bother compensating on what seems to be a manufacturing defect. So, poor quality + lame customer service, I would advice customers to look for LCD's somewhere far far away from Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Shipping sucks
Reviews.Author: Cece
Reviews.Content: I can't rate it yet.  I haven't gotten it.  I ordered my Samsung TV 10/23, was contacted for delivery 10/24.  We scheduled for 10/27 delivery.  I called when they were late and they said delivery would be in 10-15 minutes.  After 45 minutes, he was in my neighborhood and would be here shortly.  3rd call they can't get ahold of the driver.  After 4th call, they said my TV was not on the truck.  We rescheduled for 10/28 at 10 a.m. because I had to go to work.  I called when they were late and was told I'm the last on the delivery schedule.  It would be here between 12-3.  I would be gone by then.  Now we rescheduled for tomorrow morning by 8 a.m.  I hope the TV is worth the wait because the delivery service is the worst I've ever encountered.  They don't know what they're doing in that office.  I notice the price has gone down too.

Reviews.Title: soso
Reviews.Author: M. ZHANG
Reviews.Content: I have been using the TV over a month, the picture is OK. The major problems of the TV are the remote controller is quite funny, no 2 much useful buttons and it DOESN'T WORK away 3 feet ( or 150' )comparing with Sony, Samsung is quite poor. However, I paid the money for Samsung only, not Sony. :) I should add $200 to buy sony 40' v series.

Reviews.Title: Amazon customer service
Reviews.Author: R. Grosso
Reviews.Content: Check Amazon delivery date up front prior to buying. The delivery date provided by Amazon email after purchase was outside the standard 3- 5 business days. I spent over an hour (3 separate phone calls) trying to speak to a customer service person that could explain why. When I finally got connected to someone in the United States, she explained that you get the 1st customer service person and you can not get transferred. I had a choice of other tv providers and will NOT use Amazon next time.

Reviews.Title: Delay
Reviews.Author: Yi Feng Chen
Reviews.Content: I also got a Email that said they will contact me in a few day before the schedule, but they nevey called me. I sent some question to the customer serveice but haven't got an answer. I track my order has arrival in my local office for 2 day but they still don't contact, I'm very hurry now. It's so disappoint with my purchase on Amazon!

Reviews.Title: good buy!
Reviews.Author: Parker "RSD"
Reviews.Content: I have all samsung tv's in my house. As expected. this tv is great in everything!!!

Reviews.Title: poor customer service
Reviews.Author: Sara B. Barnard "Sara"
Reviews.Content: I've owned a 1080i samsung television (LNS4041) for approximately 2 years now.  After fifteen months of operation the thing went on the fritz (turn it on and purple and green vertical lines appear with a black background - no pic.).  Samsung claims I'm a few days outside my warranty and won't back up the product.  I've called to have it repaired and it will cost $130 just to have somebody look at it.  I'm thinking about smashing it into tiny bits an posting the video on YouTube.  Overall, I'm very disappointed in samsung and regret the purchase.  If you must have this television, buy the extended warranty.  As for me, I'm getting my next lcd at Wal-Mart - perhaps a sanyo.
